tourName: 10 day India tiger safari
placesVisited: Stay in three tiger reserves, two nights in Delhi, guided tour of old and New Delhi, fly to Jabalpur, Bandhavgarh National Park, Kanha National Park, Pench National Park, fly from Nagpur to Delhi, game drives, accommodation, transfers and local flights included
generalInfo:
This India safari holiday travels to three of India’s most prestigious Tiger Reserves, in search of these beautiful big cats. You’ll enjoy game drives in Bandhavgarh, Kanha and Pench National Parks, which are all found in the state of Madhya Pradesh. You will also have time to explore New Delhi at the start of this holiday, so you can see some of this great city’s famous sights. From here, fly to tiger country.

Tigers are not the only species you can hope to see while on safari. These three national parks are home to leopards, sloth bears and wild dogs, too, as well as Indian gaur, sambhar, wild boar, cheetal, languor and a huge number of birds. This safari holiday supports local conservation work, through membership of TOFT Tigers (Travel Operators for Tigers).

November, February, March and April are the best times to go on tiger safari in India. May can be very hot, but wildlife sightings are great now as undergrowth dies back and animals head to dwindling water supplies to drink. October is also possible, while December and January tend to be less busy and popular, but morning game drives in open jeeps are cold.

Do chat to us about your interests and requirements and together we can create the perfect trip. The accommodation is four star, with a mix of lodge styles throughout the holiday, but you can upgrade to five star. Families are welcome and children under 12 years enjoy a 50% discount on adult prices. There are no hidden extras, and we aim to give you an all-inclusive price, with any later additions clearly shown on your itinerary.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi, you’ll be warmly welcomed by our local representative and escorted to your hotel. This first evening offers a chance to unwind, settle in, and acclimatise after your international journey.

Delhi Sightseeing – A Tale of Two Cities Delhi is a captivating blend of ancient heritage and modern vibrancy. Rich in culture, architecture, lush gardens, and human diversity, the city’s storied past is reflected in its grand monuments, museums, and galleries. It is divided into two distinct yet harmonious halves: Old Delhi, steeped in centuries of history, and New Delhi, a legacy of the British Raj. Your day of exploration is split into two parts, each offering a unique perspective on this dynamic capital—accompanied throughout by a private guide. Morning – Old Delhi After breakfast, your guide and driver will collect you for a tour through the historic heart of the city: Jama Masjid India’s largest mosque, built in 1658, featuring two towering 40-metre minarets crafted from red sandstone and white marble. Chandni Chowk A bustling 17th-century bazaar where you’ll enjoy a rickshaw ride through its maze-like alleys, soaking in the vibrant atmosphere and fragrant spice market. Red Fort (Exterior) The imposing red sandstone walls of this UNESCO World Heritage Site stretch over two kilometres, rising 33 metres above the city’s lively streets. Raj Ghat A peaceful memorial garden marking the cremation site of Mahatma Gandhi, set along the banks of the Yamuna River. Lunch follows before your afternoon tour. Afternoon – New Delhi Your afternoon reveals the elegance and grandeur of New Delhi: Qutab Minar A 73-metre hand-carved “Tower of Victory,” showcasing exquisite Afghan architecture. Humayun’s Tomb

Delhi to Jabalpur – Journey to Kanha After breakfast at your hotel, you'll be transferred to the airport for your mid-morning flight from Delhi to Jabalpur. Please ensure you have your flight booking and passport ready for entry into the terminal—queues can form during busy periods.Baggage allowance: 15 kg for checked luggage and 7 kg for hand luggage. Upon arrival in Jabalpur, you'll transfer by car to your lodge near Kanha National Park. The drive takes approximately 5 hours, with a short comfort stop en route. Once at the lodge, you'll have time to settle in before gathering for pre-dinner drinks and snacks, followed by a freshly prepared dinner. Welcome to Kanha National Park Nestled among dense bamboo forests, stately Sal groves, and rolling meadows, Kanha National Park is one of India’s most scenic and biodiverse reserves. While the tiger is the star attraction, the park is also home to: Leopards Chital and Sambar deer Jackals Common langurs Three-striped palm squirrels Four-horned antelope Gaur (Indian bison) Over 200 species of birds One of the park’s most breathtaking spots is Sunset Point, where you can witness the forest bathed in golden light and observe wildlife typical of the mixed forest zone.

Tiger Reserve Safari Experience Each day offers the thrill of morning and evening game drives through the Tiger Reserve—an unforgettable way to immerse yourself in India’s wild landscapes and observe its majestic wildlife. Game drives are led by qualified and experienced naturalists, whose deep knowledge of the region enhances every sighting and encounter. You'll travel in open 4x4 Gypsy jeeps, specially designed for optimal viewing and photography, with seating for four passengers to ensure comfort and unobstructed views. Morning Drive: Begin your day with a sunrise safari, when wildlife is most active and the forest is alive with birdsong and movement. Evening Drive: Return to the reserve in the late afternoon for another chance to spot elusive predators and witness the forest bathed in golden light. During the morning outing, breakfast is served at a designated rest area within the park, allowing you to enjoy a meal surrounded by nature. Lunch and dinner are served back at the lodge, offering a chance to relax and reflect on the day’s sightings.

Experience the thrill of morning and evening game drives through the Tiger Reserve—an ideal way to encounter wildlife and explore India’s rich natural habitats. Each safari is led by a qualified and knowledgeable naturalist, ensuring insightful guidance throughout your journey. You'll travel in open 4x4 Gypsy jeeps, comfortably seating four passengers for unobstructed views and excellent photographic opportunities. Breakfast is served at a designated rest stop within the park, allowing you to stay immersed in nature, while lunch and dinner are enjoyed back at the lodge, offering a relaxing end to each day’s adventure.

Journey to Bandhavgarh National Park After breakfast, check out and begin your scenic drive to Bandhavgarh National Park, located in the Vindhya Hills of Madhya Pradesh. The park spans a core area of 105 sq km, surrounded by a buffer zone of approximately 400 sq km. Its diverse terrain includes steep ridges, tropical forests, open meadows, and rocky hills—making it one of India’s most picturesque wildlife reserves. Bandhavgarh is renowned for its high density of Royal Bengal Tigers, the highest in India. In addition to tigers, the park is home to a rich variety of wildlife including: Leopards Jungle cats Jackals Sloth bears Wild boars Nilgai and Sambar deer Rhesus macaques and black-faced langurs Over 250 species of birds, including winter migrants and birds of prey like the steppe eagle Arrival & Afternoon Safari Upon arrival at Bandhavgarh, check in to your lodge and enjoy a relaxing lunch. Later in the afternoon, set out on a game drive in an exclusive 4x4 Gypsy jeep, guided by expert naturalists. Explore the park’s dramatic landscape of dense Sal and bamboo forests, steep cliffs, and open grasslands—prime terrain for spotting elusive predators and diverse wildlife. Evening at the Lodge

Wildlife Encounters in Bandhavgarh Each day in Bandhavgarh National Park is filled with adventure, featuring morning and evening game drives led by expert naturalists. These safaris offer the best opportunity to explore the park’s diverse habitats and observe its incredible wildlife in action. You'll travel in open 4x4 Gypsy jeeps, designed for optimal viewing and photography, with knowledgeable guides enhancing your experience with insights into animal behaviour, tracking, and conservation. Bandhavgarh is famed for its high density of Royal Bengal Tigers, but the park is also home to a rich variety of other species, including: Leopards Asian Elephants Chital and Sambar deer Jackals and Jungle Cats Three-striped Palm Squirrels Common Langurs Over 250 bird species, including migratory birds and raptors Breakfast is served at a designated rest stop within the park, allowing you to stay immersed in nature throughout your morning safari. Lunch and dinner are enjoyed back at the lodge, offering a chance to relax and reflect on the day’s sightings in comfort.

Enjoy morning and evening game drives through the Tiger Reserve—an exceptional way to experience India’s wildlife and immerse yourself in its natural habitats. Each safari is led by qualified and experienced naturalists in open 4x4 Gypsy jeeps, comfortably seating four passengers for optimal viewing and photography. Breakfast is served at a designated rest stop within the park, allowing you to stay surrounded by nature throughout your morning adventure. Lunch and dinner are served at the lodge, offering a relaxed and welcoming setting to unwind after each thrilling day.

Return to Delhi Your final morning in Bandhavgarh begins with an early check-out from the lodge. A packed breakfast will be provided for the journey as you embark on a direct drive to Jabalpur Airport, approximately 4.5 hours away. Please ensure you have your passport and flight booking ready for airport entry, and note the baggage allowance: 15 kg for checked luggage and 7 kg for hand luggage. Upon arrival at Jabalpur, you’ll board your afternoon flight to Delhi, where you’ll be met and transferred to your airport hotel for a comfortable overnight stay or onward travel preparations. This marks the end of your safari adventure—rich in wildlife, culture, and unforgettable memories.

After breakfast, you'll be transferred to the international airport for check-in and your onward flight home. For guests opting to extend their journey, your guide will meet you at the hotel to begin your additional itinerary.

tourName: Best of Central India wildlfe tour
generalInfo:
Tigers are special, rare and critically endangered predators. They are the most majestic creatures on Earth. A desire to see the big cat lurks in the heart of one and all. But the predator is elusive with enticing behavioral traits. Difficult to search for a lot of hard work and logic is required to arrive at a spot where the majestic creature is present.

In the wild the predators are hard to see but one sight is for a lifetime. Easily described as the most beautiful and magnificent animal it is found in the jungles of Central India.

Depending on what time your flight arrives/departs New Delhi; you could do a Food Walk in the city to experience and taste the food history of India. It lasts for a few hours.

Take a flight to Nagpur later drive to Tadoba National park, evening safari The Project Tiger Reserve encompasses Tadoba National Park & Andhari River Wildlife Sanctuary. The river is a vital life support system. The Southern tropical dry deciduous forests are home to tigers, leopards, wild dogs, deer, sloth bear and bison apart from diverse wilderness. The mugger crocodile is also found here. The wildlife reserve has become popular for tiger safari because of frequent sightings of tigers in their natural habitat. You will be able to see and photograph the big cats on your tour with ease. As wildlife tour specialists we will leave no stone un turned to make your safaris as exciting as it could. It will be a journey of discovery and a photographic expedition that would yield amazing results.
Morning & Evening Safari
Morning & Evening Safari

After Breakfast drive to Pench National Park. Kipling penned Jungle Book based on the story of Mowgli who was born here. Tigers abound and Pench National Park is a good place to see them in their wilderness haunts. Mammals can be seen in the grasslands while birds frolic in the forests. The Totlah Doh dam offers sighting of shore birds and divers.
Morning & Evening Safari
Morning & Evening Safari

After Breakfast drive to Kanha National park,On heart thumping tiger safari you witness wildlife at its thrilling most - day in and day out. Kanha National Park is a tiger landscape set in the Satpura Hills with table top mountains and dense Sal forests. The moist dry deciduous forests contain vast stretches of grasslands, bamboo and mixed forests in panoramic settings amidst the perennial rivers – Sulkum, Banjar and Halon. The tributaries abound along with innumerable water bodies that together support life. I rate this park as one of the finest habitats for tigers. The wide expanse of ecosystems here accord beauty and grace, they turn the settings serene and captivating. The experience is simply action-packed and the safaris thrilling.

tourName: Black panther photography tour in India
generalInfo:
There are few animals in the world that evoke such imagery and emotion as the sleek, glossy form of a jet black panther walking through vibrant green jungle. But for many years the idea of seeing one of these unusual leopards in the wild was a pipe dream. But then a dominant male leopard in a place called Kabini, part of Nagarhole National Park in Southern India changed all of that.

Introduction:
When thinking of the vast subcontinent of India from an environmental point of view it is often easy to think of a thriving sea of humanity and great swathes of land cleared for rice production and large landfills where poor Indian children collect items they can sell for pittance; all of this mixed with the horror stories of tiger poaching.

The very idea of there being large and well protected populations of wildlife and big ecosystems still home to a great variety of wildlife seems strange. But that is the case in some areas of southern India, the Western Ghats region is home to many species of wildlife and some of the last large populations of megafauna. This trip will focus on one such place, the stunning Nagahole National Park. This is a largely forested areas and home to a diverse collection of wildlife.

This tour is focused, not on just one species but actually one individual animal, there is a large male leopard that occupies a territory in the tourism zone near Kabini. Over the last few years this particular leopard has become globally famous and also one of the most sought after and photographed animals in the world. The reason being that this particular male leopard is melanistic. Meaning that it has a special gene which results the general colour pattern of leopards (yellowish with black rosettes) not being present; instead the rosettes are hidden under a dark pelage of jet black.

This is of course the famed and fabled black leopard, black panther the living incarnation of Bagheera from Rudyard Kipling’s Jungle Books himself.
We have a high success rate of around 90% in seeing this black panther (as well as one or two other black panthers that are also in the area) and we hope to continue this success for your tour and many more in the future.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in Bangalore. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers. We have great photographer guides for this and out other wildlife photography trips; this photography guide will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through India and particularly Kabini. Your photographer guide or naturalist escort is an expert in the wildlife of Kabini and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing as well as getting perfect pictures.

The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching and wildlife photography locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide).

Seasons:

This tour is recommended for mid November - mid December as this is during this time of year that the national park authorities clear the overgrowth of vegetation from the seasonal monsoon and so there is increased visibility into the forest and also the removal of the vegetation allows for increased big cat activity as they are out and scent marking their territories more.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife photography holidays are guided by an experienced wildlife photographers as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our wildlife photographer guide that escorts all our safaris has great experience working with and photographing wild animals all over the world and in particular the wildlife of India.
• Our local Indian guides around Kabini have a good relationship with the park officials and because of this we get a heads up when animals are sighted and this can guide us in where to focus and thus increasing our chances of seeing our targeted species.
• Visit the park morning and afternoon in your own private jeep for your group only.
• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife photography and Indian big cat safaris a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout India so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the tigers, leopards, sloth bears, dhole and many more species. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of India at other times of year and focusing on other species such as striped hyena and snow leopards, Indian one-horned rhinos, Western Ghats endemics, elephants, primates, Asiatic lions and many species throughout this incredible country. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour is completely focused on one region within one national park and tiger reserve, the Kabini region of Nagarhole National Park. It is located in Karnataka state. We will fly in and out of Bangalore, which is your entry and exit point for the trip.

Fitness Level:

The vast majority of wildlife watching is all done from a vehicle. So no physical fitness for hiking or anything like that is needed. This is a very easy trip to undertake.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old

tourName: Central India wildlife safari, India's predators
generalInfo:
The most famous predator in India is of course the iconic and majestic Tiger, but it is not the only predator in the Central Indian forests and grasslands. These include a smaller cousin of the tiger, the elusive leopard as well as the Indian pack hunting wild dog (also known as dhole) and the shagged haired sloth bear.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of Indian wildlife watching safari holidays. These tours range from the dry desert regions of Gujarat in search of striped hyena and Asiatic lions to the icy peaks of the Himalayas on the quest for snow leopards. But we also focus heavily on some of the 40 plus Tiger Reserves in this wonderful and diverse country. But it is not just the wildlife of India that makes India such a great holiday destination, but the varied and unique culture is also a focus for our trips.

This tour is a specialist tiger safari of one of the best locations in the world for tigers and a host of other large mammals in India. Tadoba Andhari National Park has one of the highest density of wild tigers in the world. As well as the large population of tigers the park is also home to a great range of other species of predators, which are seen more readily here than many other locations in India. These are leopards, dhole and sloth bear. These predators live alongside their prey such as guar, barasingha, chital, sambar, wild boar and many other species.

Because this tour is only focused on Tadoba National Park you can add on extensions to also visit many of the cultural highlights such as the Taj Mahal or Old Delhi. If you are interested in adding on more to this Indian Budget Tiger Safari please let us know.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in Mumbai and Nagpur. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through India and particularly Tadoba. Your naturalist escort is an expert in tigers and their conservation and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. We will also employ a specific cultural guide for all sightseeing of temples and monuments.

The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, river safaris, spotlighting, guided walks, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

This tour is recommended for February - May as this is the dry season and the chances of seeing tigers is much higher in the dry season. However the temperatures from April onward can be very hot and humid. You can visit this park and enjoy the itinerary between October – June. The park is closed during the monsoon season.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• Our local Indian guides around Tadoba have a good relationship with the park officials and because of this we get a heads up when animals are sighted and this can guide us in where to focus and thus increasing our chances of seeing our targeted species.
• Visit the park morning and afternoon in your own private jeep for your group only.
• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and tiger safaris of India a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout India so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the tigers, leopards, sloth bears, dhole and many more species. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of India at other times of year and focusing on other species such as brown and snow leopards, Indian one-horned rhinos, Western Ghats endemics, elephants, primates, Asiatic lions and many species throughout this incredible country. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.

Locations:

This tour is completely focused on one national park and tiger reserve, Tadoba. It is located in Maharasthra. We will fly in and out of Mumbai, which is your entry and exit point for the trip.

dayInfo.description: Mumbai- On arrival into Mumbai international airport, you will be met by your guide and transferred to your hotel. Depending on the time of arrival we will spend some time exploring the city in a half day city tour. (no meals included today)

Mumbai- Tadoba Andhari National Park - After breakfast in Mumbai you will catch the flight to the city of Nagpur (the closest airport to Tadoba National Park). From here you will then drive to Tadoba National park (4.5-5 hrs). Tadoba National Park- is one of the largest and most scenic national parks in India, it has an ideal habitat for both tigers and their prey species. The lush sal and bamboo forests, grassy meadows and ravines of Tadoba shelter a significant population of rare species such as tiger, leopard, sloth bear, barasingha and dhole. tourName: East India national parks wildlife tour
generalInfo:
Three diverse national parks and wildlife habitats in Singalila, Kaziranga and Sunderban

- An adventure that showcases habitats ranging from the high Himalayas, to bio-diverse floodplains to rich mangrove forests at sea level

- Enjoy diverse ways of exploring including walking, jeep safaris and boat excursions

- Search for elusive mammals like Red Panda, Indian One-horned Rhino, Royal Bengal Tiger, Asiatic Elephants, Wild Buffaloes, Hoolock Gibbons and many more


- Witness the diverse birdlife of Eastern India ranging from high mountains to estuaries

- Be guided by experts in each location who know the landscape and its wildlife intimately

The Wild Wonders of East India journey takes you to some of the most fascinating wildlife habitats of the Eastern part of India. The wildlife sojourn starts at one of the most special Eastern Himalayan Landscapes, the Singalila National Park. This is the best place in India to see the elusive firefox or Red Panda. The Red Panda is a mammal native to Eastern Himalayas and Southwest China. The Red Panda has been classified as Endangered by the IUCN because its wild population is estimated at less than 10,000 mature individuals living in the wild. Singalila is one of its last strong holds and it is also the best place in India to see this elusive and rare mammal. Red Pandas are best found at an altitude ranging from 2,500 meters to 4,000 meters, and this part of the journey will be conducted at this altitude.

After a 5 nights quest to search for the elusive Red Panda the journey continues to Kaziranga National Park, a UNESCO world heritage site which was declared a tiger reserve in 2006. Kaziranga is a paradise for megafauna. It is stronghold for the endangered Indian One Horned Rhino with over 2,600 (2/3 of the global population) residing in its grassland and floodplain habitat. Apart from rhinos, it is home to many mammal species, including tigers, elephants, Asiatic wild buffalo, leopard, bears, swamp deer, hog deer, hoolock gibbons, smooth coated otters and a high diversity of birds.

The next and final stop on this journey is another UNESCO world heritage site and the largest mangrove forest in the world, the Sunderban Tiger Reserve. Nestled in the delta of the Ganges, Brahmaputra, and Meghna rivers, this intricate landscape is home to the elusive Royal Bengal tiger, as well as a wealth of other wildlife including saltwater crocodiles, wild boars, and a myriad of bird species. Visitors can embark on thrilling boat safaris that weave through the forest’s dense, tidal channels, offering glimpses of the rare flora and fauna in their natural habitat. A journey through the Sundarbans is not just a chance to witness its unparalleled biodiversity but also an opportunity to engage with the rich cultural tapestry and traditions of the communities living in harmony with this wild, ever-changing landscape.

dayInfo.description: Arrival at Delhi International airport Transfer to hotel and day at leisure Raddison Blu Plaza, Delhi Airport and relaxation.

Along with our expert naturalist, guests can also participate in tracking the elusive Red Panda using established trails in the park. Singalila is home to several species of birds and guests can also engage themselves with bird watching, while the trackers are out looking for Red Panda. Lunch will be served on the field or at the lodge, depending on the wildlife activities that we decide to do. Dinner and overnight at Manebhajen

Hot lunch to be served at the homestay After an unforgettable adventure spotting the elusive Red Pandas, it's time to bid adieu to Manebhanjan and head to Siliguri post lunch. Arrival in Siliguri by the evening and check in to the Courtyard by Marriot, Siliguri.

After a hot breakfast at your hotel, an airport transfer will be arranged to Siliguri airport. You will take a flight from Siliguri to Guwahati, where a vehicle will be waiting upon your arrival. From Guwahati drive 5 hours on a picturesque road to Kaziranga National Park and check into Infinity Resort, Kaziranga. Evening at leisure.

Today post breakfast you will be doing 6 game drives over 3 days guest will go out and explore the park in 4X4 jeeps. Kaziranga is a heaven for large mammals. The one-horned rhino is the star attraction. Asiatic elephants roam in big herds and Asiatic wild buffaloes find this landscape as one of their last refuges. Tigers are plenty in Kaziranga, but because of the tall elephant grasses not always easy to see. Eastern swamp deer, spotted deer, sambar deer and hog deer are some of the prey species found here. Smooth coated otters are sometimes seen in the swamps and water bodies and a plethora of birdlife can be seen on drives. If lucky, the fishing cat, could be a prize catch. Guests finish their drive and come back to the lodge by 10.30 AM. Post lunch another game drive will be arranged with similar chances of sightings. Based on the guest suitability Sagar will take a session on photography either in the day time or just before dinner. Dinner and overnight at Infinity Kaziranga.

After Morning breakfast, you will be departing to Guwahati 5 Hrs drive from Kaziranga for your onward journey to board a flight to Kolkata. Upon your arrival in Kolkatta airport, a vehicle will take you towards the Godkhali Jetty approach to Sunderban. You will drive couple of hours through scenic landscape to reach the jetty. At the jetty board the boat and onwards to Sunderban Tiger Camp. Arrival and evening at leisure A short introductory session and short briefing session from the naturalist about the forest, the flora and fauna, and the special habitat of the swamp tigers along with bird watching and photography on the way to resort.

Sunrise to Sunset Boat Safari Early Morning Departure from Waxpol Ghat (timing will be notified a day before by the Group Leader approx. time is 5.30 am-6.00 am). Breakfast and Lunch will be served hot and fresh on the boat itself during the safari as the main species for this trip is the Swamp Tiger, we will search for pug marks on mud banks and depending on our findings and information from our well-equipped tracking team; we will set the cruise route for every day. It is important to note that this route may or may not change every day, as we will be concentrating on recent tiger movements and possible movement paths. Apart from tracking the big cat, we will also be on the lookout for other birds and mammals. Throughout the day we will cruise through several creeks, rivers and rivulets. After the safari the guests will return to the resort for dinner and an overnight stay.
Early Morning Departure from Waxpol Ghat after checkout. "Depart from Sunderbans to Kolkata Airport, and then proceed to Delhi for an international flight.

tourName: Golden Triangle and Central India tiger safari
generalInfo:
India is a medley of multiple components, a country so diverse that it may take several visits to explore the whole nation. However, for anyone visiting India for the first time, there are two aspects of the country that stand out. The Taj Mahal and the Tiger. And these two stand out not in isolation but in inclusion of all that surrounds them. This itinerary is a classic journey for those who maybe visiting India for the first time. For those who have not experienced the marvels of northern India and marvels of the verdant forests of Central India that inspired Rudyard Kipling. The journey gives a flavour of India’s rich history in Delhi where different eras of rule of stamped their mark, to the impact of Maharaja’s in the pink city of Jaipur leading on to Agra where the iconic Taj Mahal is world famous. After a romance with India’s royal past the journey takes you to the central Indian jungles to see another royal, India’s national animal, the Royal Bengal Tiger. India’s highly successful tiger conservation program which commenced in 1972, not only saved the tiger, but also all the other forest denizens that share the forest with it. Madhya Pradesh is the tiger state of India, with over 750 tigers in the wild it is the best place in the world to see tigers in the wild. Visit the up-and-coming Satpura National Park, Bori Wildlife Sanctuary and the better known Pench Tiger Reserve. Apart from tiger, these forests are home to leopard, sloth bear, Indian wild dog, Indian gaur, sambar deer, spotted deer and a host of other mammals. Birdlife is abundant here and a visit to these parks is a dream of any bird watcher. Enjoy a burst of both cultural and nature-based experiences through various highlights like…
• History visit and sightseeing in Delhi
• Exploring the pink city Jaipur
• Visting the Taj Mahal
• Enjoying a train journey to the city of Bhopal
• Exploring central Indian forests
• Jeep, walking, boat and night safaris
• Exquisite Indian cuisine
• Immersing into local life and culture
This journey is a must do for anyone visiting India for the first time who is inclined towards experiencing a blend of culture and nature alike.

dayInfo.description: Arrival at Delhi International airport Transfer to Taj Palace and day at leisure and relaxation.

After breakfast, explore historic landmarks in Delhi such as the Red Fort, Jama Masjid, and India Gate. Visit bustling markets like Chandni Chowk and Connaught Place, and explore museums such as the National Museum and Gandhi Smriti. Delhi, the vibrant capital of India, is a kaleidoscope of culture, history, and modernity. Dive into the city's rich heritage by exploring iconic landmarks such as the Red Fort, Qutub Minar, and Jama Masjid. Indulge in a shopping spree at bustling markets like Chandni Chowk or savor Delhi's culinary delights from street food to fine dining. Immerse yourself in the local lifestyle with a rickshaw ride through Old Delhi's narrow lanes or witness the peaceful coexistence of religions at Lotus Temple. From ancient monuments to bustling bazaars, Delhi offers a perfect blend of tradition and contemporary allure on your Golden Triangle itinerary. Overnight stay at Delhi Taj Palace
After breakfast, check out from the hotel and drive to Jaipur (approx. 6 hours, 315 km). Lunch at Jaipur and overnight stay at Jai Mahal Palace.

Jaipur, the vibrant Pink City of India, exudes a rich tapestry of culture and heritage that captivates visitors from around the world. Known for its majestic palaces, bustling bazaars, and colorful festivals, Jaipur offers a glimpse into Rajasthan's royal past and artistic traditions. The city's architectural marvels like the Amber Fort and Hawa Mahal narrate tales of grandeur and opulence. Dive into Jaipur's culture through its traditional music, folk dances, and sumptuous Rajasthani cuisine. The warmth and hospitality of its residents, coupled with the city's timeless charm, make Jaipur a captivating destination where history and culture converge in a kaleidoscope of experiences., including Amber Fort, Hawa Mahal, and City Palace. Visit the Jantar Mantar observatory and Albert Hall Museum. Shop for local handicrafts at the bazaars and enjoy Rajasthani cuisine. Overnight stay at Jai Mahal Palace.
After morning breakfast, check out from the hotel and drive to Agra (distance 235 km, duration 5 hours). Overnight stay at Taj View Agra.

Visit the iconic Taj Mahal at sunrise and explore Agra Fort. Explore Fatehpur Sikri, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Visit other attractions like Itmad-ud-Daulah's Tomb and Mehtab Bagh for a view of the Taj Mahal. Overnight stay at Taj View Agra

Check out from the hotel at Morning and drive to Agra Railway station to catch a train to reach Bhopal heart of central India (Duration 6:30 Hrs.) Arrival and received by chauffer and drive Jehan Numa Palace for Lunch after Lunch drive to Reni Pani Jungle lodge 3Hrs drive Relax and stay Reni Pani Jungle Lodge, Diner and Overnight stay at Reni Pani Jungle Lodge.

Morning core drive in Reni Pani Jungle Lodge - Exploring Satpura Tiger Reserve in the morning can be a great experience for wildlife enthusiasts! You may encounter a variety of animals such as tigers, leopards, sloth bears, Indian bison, and a wide range of birds and enjoy the beauty of nature breakfast will be in the park Return to lodge by 11:30 am to relax with hot lunch Night Drive in Reni Pani Jungle Lodge – Explore night drive To spot nocturnal wildlife. You may have the opportunity to see animals like leopards, sloth bear, foxes, civets’ jungle cat and if lucky rusty spotted cat the smallest wild cat in the world also various species of owls. Return you’re the lodge for drinks and dinner duration for night drive will be around 4 hours
Morning core drive at Reni Pani Jungle Lodge Evening core drive at Reni Pani Jungle Lodge Overnight stay at Reni Pani Jungle Lodge (Full Board)

Depart From Reni Pani Jungle Lodge to Bori Safari Lodge by Boat Transfers – The Saptura Tiger Reserve is a unique landscape in Central India where rugged mountains, evergreen patches, dry deciduous forests, grasslands and rivers can all be witnessed in one vista. The western and northern periphery of the park is covered by an expanse of water covering over 250 sq. kilometres of area, known as the Tawa Reservoir. Boat safaris are possible on this reservoir and Jehan Numa Wilderness has its own private boat that can be used by guests transferring between Reni Pani Jungle Lodge and Bori Safari Lodge or vice versa. The boat cruise transfer covers a distance of 35 kilometres over 2 hours on the Tawa Reservoir. This journey is mostly on the backwaters of the Denwa river, and this river meanders through some stunning landscape.
Morning core drive Churna Evening core drive Mallupura Overnight stay at Bori Safari Lodge (Full Board)
Morning core drive Churna Evening core drive Mallupura Overnight stay at Bori Safari Lodge (Full Board)
Morning Breakfast and Check out from the Bori safari Lodge Drive to Pench (4.30 Hrs). Arrival In Pench Lunch Overnight stay at Pench Tree Lodge.
Morning core drive in Pench Evening core drives at Pench Overnight stay at Pench Tree Lodge (Full Board)
Morning core drive in Pench Evening core drives at Pench Overnight stay at Pench Tree Lodge (Full Board)
Morning, after breakfast, you will depart for Nagpur Domestic Airport, which is a 3.5-hour drive, to catch your connecting flight to Delhi or Mumbai.

tourName: Golden Triangle & tigers holiday in India
placesVisited: Delhi, Old Delhi, Kutub Minar,, President House, National Museum, India Gate, Jaipur, Jaipur palaces, Agra, Taj Mahal, Red fort, Jabalpur, Kanha National Park, Tiger watching and three game drives, Sleeper train journey
generalInfo:
This nine day, tailor made holiday revolves around a carefully crafted itinerary that takes in not only the cultural highlights of Golden Triangle, India ‘s stunning historical trail, but also one of the country’s natural highlights too: seeing India’s tigers in Kanha National Park.

After a day of sightseeing in Delhi, you will head to the majestic city of Jaipur, where you are immersed in an eclectic and fascinating mix of royal architecture, from the Palace of the Winds to the Amber Fort, as well as ancient markets intermixed with this ancient majesty.

From the pink city of Jaipur to the white marble magnificence of the Taj Mahal in Agra. A vast mausoleum built by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his late wife. Famous the world over, take time here to absorb its greatness. Ironically, history has it that the emperor was imprisoned and here say has it that he was able to see his creation from his prison cell. This part of the trip also takes you to the Agra Fort and also the nearby fortified ancient city of Fatehpur Sikri, the Mughal capital, from 1571 to 1585.

From the Taj to tigers, as our next stop is Kanha National Park in Madhya Pradesh, where magnificent habitats of rich, native sal forests and open dry grasslands are the perfect terrain for India’s finest mammal. There are around a hundred tigers within the park, a large part of the park also designated as the Kanha Tiger Reserve, formed by the prestigious and pioneering Project Tiger in 1974. There is a wealth of other wildlife here too, of course, from langurs to leopard, sambhar to rare swamp deer. On the three game drives you will be accompanied by an expert naturalist guide.

The holiday cost includes bed and breakfast accommodation, driver guide and air conditioned vehicle in Delhi and Agra, entrance fees, transfers and overnight air conditioned rail journey. During your time in Kanha National Park you will stay in a luxury lodge, with all meals, game drives, park and naturalist guide fees included.

Please note that as this is a tailor made itinerary, we can always adapt it to your needs and interests. For example, many of our guests include an additional day or two to Varanasi and Khajuraho’s temples. Please do not hesitate to contact us to discuss any further ideas.

dayInfo.description: Arrive Delhi & transfer to hotel. Free to relax. Overnight hotel.
Sightseeing in Delhi, the capital city of India. Old Delhi, Kutub Minar, President House, National Museum & India Gate. Overnight hotel.

Leave for Jaipur, check-in at heritage hotel, half day sightseeing. Popularly known as the Pink City, Jaipur was founded in 1727 AD by one of the greatest rulers of the Singh. The pink colour was used to create an impression of red sandstone buildings of Mughal cities and repainted in 1876, during the visit of the Prince of Wales. The city is best explored on foot and the adventurous visitor willing to go into the inner lanes can discover a whole new world not visible to the tourist-in-a-hurry. Overnight hotel.

Jaipur sightseeing. Places of interest are mainly located within the walled city. The City Palace complex is the most important landmark with its numerous outbuildings, courtyards, impressive gateways and temples. Across the road from the palace is the Jantar Mantar, one of the five observatories built by Sawai Jai Singh. A collection of complex astronomical instruments, chiselled out of stone - most of which continue to provide fairly accurate information to this day - is the highlight of this observatory. Overnight hotel.
Leave Jaipur for Agra, visit Taj Mahal & Red fort. Late afternoon we board the train for our onward journey to Jabalpur. Overnight train
Reach Jabalpur early morning. Transfer to hotel for breakfast, freshen up. Later we drive to Kanha National Park (3hrs drive), check-in at lodge. Evening game drive
Kanha NP. Morning & evening game drive
Return to Jabalpur. Today after breakfast we drive back to Jabalpur to connect direct flight to delhi.Overnight Delhi
Transfer to International airport.

tourName: Gujarat holidays, Asiatic Lions, Blackbuck & Wild Asses
placesVisited: Gujarat wildlife safaris, Velavadar, Velavadar National Park, Gir National Park, Little Rann of Kutch, Indian Wild Ass Sanctuary
generalInfo:
This tailor made trip has been crafted by a local company that specialises in Gujarat wildlife, such as the much sought after Asiatic lions, blackbuck and wild asses. The nine day itinerary has been carefully crafted to allow plenty of time in each of the Gujarat national parks. With one full day in Velavadar National Park, famous for its beautiful blackbuck and two days in Gir National Park where the Asiatic lions take centre stage. Gir was given protected status as far back as 1900 when, after being used as a trophy hunting ground for years, the lion population was reduced to almost zero. Since then, hunting lion has been illegal and the legacy of committed conservation still stands here. A night time safari at Gir is a highlight for many of our guests.

At Velavadar NP, game drives will not only bring you in contact with over 1500 blackbuck but also wolves and jackals, although a night time safari is the time to spot the latter. There is rich birdlife, such as the lesser florican, a large bird in the bustard family that thrives in these grassland habitats.

In addition to the national parks, we also include the unique habitats of the Little Rann of Kutch in our itinerary, a saline desert that is famous for being one of the last places on earth where you can see the beautiful Indian wild ass. Other stunning wild mammals to catch sight of include the chinkara, desert fox, jackals, caracals, nilgais and striped hyenas. It is also home to over three hundred bird species, with flamingos and pelicans creating a fine sight as well as many migratory birds arriving in over the Gulf of Kutch. Our visit to the Rann region also allows us to spend time with the tribal groups still living very traditional lifestyles here.

As this is a tailor made trip, we are happy to accommodate your interests and needs, starting the holiday in Delhi or Mumbai, for example, or adding additional days to take in other experiences such as a night time leopard safari.

dayInfo.description: Arrive Ahmadabad International Airport.Our ground staff will receive you at the airport. Later drive to Velavadar. Overnight Velavadar,
Velavadar National Park. Morning & evening game drives

Drive to Gir National Park. Early morning after having breakfast we will move to Gir National Park by road, which is about 200km from Bhavnagar & will take about 5 hrs to reach. We will try to take an evening game drive.
Gir National Park. Morning & evening game drives.
Drive to the Little Rann of Kutch. After morning game drive we drive to Zainabad and the Little Rann of Kutch (280km) in North West Gujarat for a safari through the Indian Wild Ass Sanctuary.
Little Rann of Kutch. Morning & evening game drives.
Drive Zainabad - Ahmedabad (100km, 2 hrs). Depart.

tourName: Gujarat wildlife holiday, India
placesVisited: Guided tour of Old Delhi (time permitting), Salt pan and desert safaris, Little Rann of Kutch, Great Rann of Kutch, Wildlife watching in the Thar Desert, Asiatic lion tracking in Sasan Gir National Park, Wildlife safaris in Velavadar National Park, Return flight to Delhi from Ahmedabad
generalInfo:
Gujarat is home to India's driest national parks, but they are full of wildlife and surprisingly diverse. This trip focuses on Asiatic lions, striped hyena, Indian wolves and other predators that are found in the arid lands of this wonderful Indian state.

The very idea of there being large and well protected populations of wildlife and big ecosystems in India still seems strange. But that is the case in most of Gujarat, a largely desert state in the north west of the country, bordering Pakistan to the west.

To help preserve this incredible diversity, Gujarat has various protected areas including wildlife sanctuaries, national parks, reserves and large community concessions which have been established to integrate humans with wildlife in the most harmonious way possible.

Many of the protected areas in Gujarat support large mammals including Asiatic wild ass, striped hyena, blackbuck, leopard, nilgai, Indian wolf and of course the iconic and last remaining Asiatic lions; which is testament to the state's conservation ethic.

About the tour:
This two week itinerary is split into four mini-sections so as to properly explore the most impressive national parks and wilderness areas. We start with the fantastic and vast Rann of Kutch in the middle of the Thar Desert and spend three nights in both the Little and Greater Rann of Kutch. Here we will search for the endemic Asiatic wild ass as well as the rare and elusive Indian wolf before we head to the last stronghold of the critically endangered Asiatic lion in Sasan Gir National Park. Reduced to a couple of dozen at the turn of the 19th Century they have now been protected enough to have a population numbering over 400. From here we visit the reserve of Velavadar National Park which was originally set up to protect and conserve blackbuck antelopes. As well as the blackbuck we will also be on the look out for seldom seen striped hyenas. A short flight backs to Delhi makes short shrift of the distances we will have travelled overland.

More information about this Gujarat wildlife holiday:
In designing this trip we believe you will be getting the best wildlife experience of Gujarat and one that will leave you with a completely wild impression of India. January through to April is the dry, and surprisingly cold, season and best for wildlife in Gujarat. This is when we have the highest chances of seeing our targeted species. All of our Indian safaris are guided by a local naturalist guides. Local drivers and also scientists or researchers may also accompany the trip. This not only gives us numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also provides a chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife we're watching.

Minimum Age: 18 years

dayInfo.description: Delhi - Arrival - Today you will met at the airport by your local guide and take to your accommodation for the night. The rest of the day is at your leisure, if you arrive early enough in the day your local guide can help to arrange a tour of Old Delhi. (No meals included today)

Little Rann of Kutch - Travelling - This morning you will be met at the hotel by your local guide and driver to catch your flight to the capital of Gujurat and the birthplace of Mahatma Ghandi, Ahmedebad. From here you will be transferred the couple of hours or so to your first accommodation located a on the edge of the desert. The Little Rann of Kutch is a vast desert encrusted with salt left when the Arabian Sea dried and left the land here exposed and after checking into the accommodation you will have some time to rest and relax and then later in the day you will have your first trip into the desert. You will have to speak to your local guide to arrange the time, depending on how much time you want to rest and when the best times to enter are. But you will have 2 more full days after today to fully explore the desert and salt pans around here and search out the various species. In between your safari activities you will return to your lodge for meals and some rest and also to get out of the hot desert sun. (breakfast and dinner included today).

Great Rann of Kutch - Travelling & Wildlife Watching - This morning you will leave the accommodation in the Little Rann of Kutch and be transferred to Moti Virani which is located in the Banni region just south of the Great Rann of Kutch. The accommodation is run by the Centre for Desert and Ocean and is comfortable but basic. This is a research station that allows wildlife watchers to stay here and experience this incredible ecosystem. The food is all prepared by a local Kutchi family and is very traditional, the power is solar and the whole set up of the CEDO is to sustainably keep tourism coming to the Great Rann of Kutch and also contributing to the local people and local economy. Whilst staying here we will learn more about the conservation and research work that they are conducting here such as native tree plantation and eduction of the local children of the need to preserve the desert ecosystem. We will hopefully arrive in time for lunch and an afternoon safari into the remote desert regions of the Great Rann of Kutch. During the afternoon we will search for some of the rarer mammals here such a caracal, leopard, Indian wolf, Indian fox and as the sunlight fades to the horizon some of the more common species might be seen; such as long-eared hedgehogs, Indian hedgehogs, lesser bandicoot rats and Indian gerbils as well as other insectivores and rodents. for Indian bustards. (breakfast, lunch and dinner included)

Gondal - Travelling - Today you will start the long journey from the Great Rahn of Kutch to the world famous Sasan Gir National Park (home of the last wild Asiatic lions and also the only place outside of Africa where you can see wild lions). This is a long journey so we will break this up by spending tonight at the regally named Riverside & Orchard Palace hotel in Gondal. The hotel was built as an annex of the Huzoor Palace during the British Raj period and the gardens and royal memorabilia is a nice break from wildlife watching and a nice place to rest. But if you wish the surrounding areas are good for nilgai and some small mammals at night. (breakfast and dinner included)

Sasan Gir National Park - Travelling - This morning you will be transferred from Gondal and continue your journey to the last stronghold of Asiatic lions in the world. Asiatic lions were once widespread from Italy in the west to the eastern side of India in the east, but due to habitat destruction and intensive hunting since the times of the Ancient Greeks they were reduced to around 20 individuals. But the Maharaja of Gir forest foresaw their extinction as his hunts were getting less and less productive. He then protected the last few (firstly for hunts and then for their continued survival) and since then the forests and scrubland of Sasan Gir has been protected (for around 100 years) and their numbers are now booming. There are now over 400 lions in the park and they are beginning to spread out into the neighbouring villages. This could lead to human-animal conflicts in the future so there is encouraging talk of reintroducing some of the lions into another national park nearby to start a second population. The supreme court in Delhi ruled in favour of translocating some lions from Gir to Kuno in Madhya Pradesh in April 2013 and this is expected to be done before the end of 2013. This drastically improves the lions long term chances of survival as it will increase genetic diversity and help in case of a disease outbreak in Gir. Once we arrive here we will in plenty of time to check into the accommodation and head into the park in the afternoon. This lodge is one of the best in the area and it actually shares a boundary wall with the park, in the recent past lions have been seen in the gardens of the resort whilst people were enjoying their dinner in the main building; it is worth bearing this in mind and looking around the gardens when heading for dinner in the evening or the early morning jeep safaris. When we have our first jeep safari into the park we will be looking for lions and they are not particularly difficult to find, with over 400 lions in a small area we should see them without too much difficulty (although they are not always seen on every safari. Also whilst here in the evenings we will be on the lookout for leopards. Leopards are very hard to see in India, they are displaced by tigers throughout the majority of Indian parks but their interactions with lions is different and as a result they are seen here more regularly than any other park in India. Of course the leopards are still hard to see here but we are in the best place for them. (breakfast, lunch and dinner included)

Velavadar National Park - Travelling & Safaris - This morning you can have a leisurely breakfast where you do not have to be up before dawn and after breakfast you will be taken back towards Ahmedabad but before getting back to the city you will be taken to the last national park of the tour; Velavadar National Park. This is one of the best national parks in India, home to large populations of beautiful blackbuck and probably the best places in the world to see the striped hyena. This is one of the most elusive species of mammal in the world and here there are a couple of den sites that the local guides know of. Today will be your first chance to see this incredible animal after checking into the lodge and we enter the park. The park was initially set up for the protection of blackbuck which are now doing very well. It is also the best place to see nilgai but during the evenings we will be focused on striped hyena, Indian wolves, Indian foxes and jungle cats; before returning to the lodge for your evening meal. Despite these elusive and wonderful predators the true star of the park are the many blackbuck; despite being popular in animal collections on private estates in both Europe and North America, the wild population in India decreased drastically over the last century and fragmented into various pockets from a former position of abundance throughout the plains. Velavadar Reserve now probably has the highest concentration of Blackbuck in the world with the very regal dark males with their long spiraled horns strutting their stuff for the females they are very fun to watch. (breakfast and dinner included)

Delhi - Travelling - Today you will leave Velavadar and be taken back to Ahmedabad to catch your return flight to Delhi. We recommend booking your return flight home from Delhi to depart in the late evening or night so you arrive from Ahmedabad in plenty of time. (Breakfast only today)

tourName: India Golden Triangle and tiger safari holiday
generalInfo:
The Golden Triangle circuit comprising of Delhi, Agra and Jaipur is one of the most visited regions of India. Various UNESCO Sites like Taj Mahal, Fatehpur Sikri, Agra Fort, Qutub Minar, Monuments of Jaipur etc. are the highlights. Apart from these standard highlights, this tour includes awesome bespoke experiences like village visits, local interactions, Yoga sessions, food tours, wildlife safaris and much more.

Trip Highlights:

1. Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Delhi and experience the imperial and Mughal architecture.
2. Visit one of the 7 wonders of the world - Taj Mahal and discover the magic of white marble at Agra.
3. Energize yourself at Morning Taj Facing Yoga Session at Agra.
4. Visit the world-renowned Ranthambore National Park – Known for tigers and other species of animals – Go on an Open Jeep/Canter Safari to explore the national park.
5. Enjoy a guided tour of the Pink City.
6. Enjoy food tour in Jaipur

After breakfast, proceed for a full day Jaipur sightseeing tour with your Guide. •Visit Amber Fort – One of the most magnificent palaces in India. (The Fort is perched on a hill, so to reach there; you may enjoy a Jeep ride in Amber fort. •Visit Jantar Mantar – largest stone astronomical observatory in the world. •Visit to City Palace and Museum– Built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh during the years 1729 to 1732. •Photo Stop Hawa Mahal – built by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh in the year 1799. •In the evening enjoy Heena Painting on Hands and Feet.
After breakfast check out from hotel and travel to New Delhi International Airport (270Km, 5 Hours drive) to board the flight for you home town.

tourName: India nocturnal wildlife safari
generalInfo:
This unique Indian wildlife safari holiday is focused on the rare opportunity Panna National Park gives people to explore the forests after dark and see some of the elusive and rarely seen species of Central India.

Many people who have been on a safari to India have noticed in the wildlife books there are many species, from civets and hyenas to owls and nightjars which are rarely if ever seen. This is because these species and many others are strictly nocturnal. So we have found a way of getting into the forests safely after dark to try and see these species, in addition we have a much higher chance of seeing species such as leopards, sloth bear and tigers which are also largely nocturnal too.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of Indian wildlife watching safari holidays. These tours range from the dry desert regions of Gujarat in search of striped hyena and Asiatic lions to the icy peaks of the Himalayas on the quest for snow leopards. But we also focus heavily on some of the 40 plus Tiger Reserves in this wonderful and diverse country. One of these reserves is Panna National Park, a little visited but large park with a population of tigers inhabiting it – but without the large numbers of tourists that can be found in the more popular and well known parks.

This tour doesn't just enter the main park in search of tigers, dhole and other typical Indian tiger safari species (which are included), but we also spend time outside of the main park and in the buffer zones where we stay overnight in a wonderful tented camp and have night safaris.

After years of travelling to India we have been asked many times about why we cannot spotlight in the parks after dark to try and find the really interesting animals. Such as striped hyenas, leopards, leopard cats, Bengal foxes, Asiatic crested porcupines and the numerous civets and genets which live in India. We are now able to head into the buffer zone after dark and spotlight for wildlife, this has increased the sightings of usually difficult and elusive species. So if you have always wanted to see the Indian wildlife which is usually out of sight, then this is the wildlife tour for you.

Panna is one of India's less visited parks, so you can often have the park and surrounding buffer zones to yourself or with very little other tourists, which is a rare event in Indian tiger reserves nowadays.

In addition to this tour we have an incredible range of safaris in India. Whether you wish to visit the Western Ghats for its endemic species, Gujarat for the desert adapted species, the high grasslands of the North East for giants such as rhinos, elephants and buffalo or even head to the Himalayas for snow leopard spotting we have the itinerary for you. India is a treasure trove of wildlife and habitats and all you have to do is to get in touch with your budget and your group size and where you would like to go and we will come back to you with an itinerary and quote for your perfect Indian wildlife safari tour.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in Delhi. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through India and particularly Panna. Your naturalist escort is an expert in tigers and their conservation and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing.

The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

The best time to go wildlife watching in Central India is mid January to mid May. This is the hot dry season with the hottest time from beginning March until mid May. This is when many species come out to waterholes to find water.
However you can visit this park and enjoy the itinerary between November – April.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.• Our local Indian guides around Panna have a good relationship with the park officials and because of this we get a heads up when animals are sighted and this can guide us in where to focus and thus increasing our chances of seeing our targeted species.
• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and tiger safaris of India a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout India so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the tigers, leopards, sloth bears, dhole and many more species. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of India at other times of year and focusing on other species such as brown and snow leopards, Indian one-horned rhinos, Western Ghats endemics, elephants, primates, Asiatic lions and many species throughout this incredible country. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour is completely focused on one national park and tiger reserve, Panna. It is located in Madhya Pradesh. We will fly in and out of Delhi and then travel onto Khajuraho before reaching the park in the Indian wilderness.

Fitness Level:

All of this safari is done from a vehicle. So no physical fitness for hiking or anything like that is needed. This is a very easy trip to undertake.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 15 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Delhi - Arrival On arrival at Delhi international airport you will be met by your local guide and driver and from here be transferred to your hotel. The rest of the day will be at your leisure. (no meals included today).

Delhi - Panna National Park - Travelling This morning you will be transferred to the domestic airport terminal to catch your flight to Khajuraho (1.5 hour). From here your new driver will take you to your lodge located on the banks of the Ken River and on the border of Panna National Park. On arrival here, you will check in and have your evening meal. (breakfast and dinner are included today, lunch is not included today).

Panna National Park - Wildlife Watching Today you will enter Panna National Park twice, once in the early morning and once in the late afternoon. You can choose your activity (on private tours) between jeep safaris or boat trips down the Ken River. However we recommend jeep safaris as they cover more ground and will enable you to see a larger area of the park and have better chances of seeing wildlife such as tigers. Many people regard Panna National Park to be one of the most aesthetically beautiful parks in all of India. You will return to the lodge in between wildlife watching excursions. (all meals included).

Panna National Park - Wildlife Watching Today you will once again be able to explore Panna National Park twice (after returning from Jhinna Camp), you are once again free to decide on whether you would like a river cruise or jeep safari in the morning and the afternoon. Today is your last full day here and if we have not seen a tiger then we recommend trying hard for tigers today. As with the previous days you will return to the lodge for your meals. (all meals included).

Panna National Park - Wildlife Watching This morning before breakfast you will enter the park for the last time (either via a boat or jeep) to look for wildlife. When you return you will have breakfast and check out. You will be transferred back to the ancient city of Khajuraho in time to catch your return flight to Delhi. On return to Delhi you will be transferred to your hotel for your final night. (breakfast only included).
Departure Today you will be taken to Delhi airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast only is included).

tourName: India off the beaten track wildlife tour
generalInfo:
If you have always felt like exploring new and interesting places and not just following the crowd when it comes to safari destinations? Then this tiger safari for you.

On this Indian safari you will travel to two little known and seldom visited tiger reserves. Whilst we will be of course looking for tiger throughout we will also be occupying our time in Satpura and Panna National Parks with with searches for sloth bears, dhole, leopards, gaur, striped hyenas and jungle cats to name but a few.

This tour is quite unusual as it will not only combine day time safaris but also spotlighting night safaris (which is very unusual in India). Searching for animals by day and night is a new experience in India and all of a sudden animals which were deemed impossible to see are being spotted; such as striped hyena and leopard cats. Satpura, Panna and Jhinna are on the rise but if you book soon you may still be the only foreign people inside the park.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of Indian wildlife watching safari holidays. These tours range from the dry desert regions of Gujarat in search of striped hyena and Asiatic lions to the icy peaks of the Himalayas on the quest for snow leopards. But we also focus heavily on some of the 40 plus Tiger Reserves in this wonderful and diverse country. Two of these reserves are Satpura and Panna National Parks, both not often visited national parks but both full of incredible wildlife – but without the large numbers of tourists that can be found in the more popular and well known parks.

This tour explores these great parks on the trail of tigers of course, this iconic denizen of the Indian jungles is as symbolic of India as the Taj Mahal or Mahatma Ghandi. Satpura has a fantastic record for also showing the other predators of the jungle. Whilst rare and hard to see in other parks the leopards, sloth bears and dhole are all regularly seen here. So we will dedicate a large amount time to these species as well as the tigers whilst here.

Panna also has a good dhole and tiger population but another reason for visiting these two parks is that they allow a couple of things that other national parks and tiger reserves in India do not. Firstly you can stay overnight inside the park, there is a small lodging complex deep in the park.

They are a little more basic than the lodges of course but it allows you experience the park at night from within and also allows to get deeper into the jungle on our safaris as we do not have to come back to the entry gate in the evening.

But also along the buffer zone of the park we can go out after dark and spotlight. This is a great way of seeing some of India’s rarer and more elusive species such as leopards, striped hyena, Indian porcupine, common palm civet as well as owls and nightjars.

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in Delhi. Your naturalist escort is an expert in tigers and their conservation and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing.

The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, river safaris, spotlighting, guided walks, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

This tour is recommended to run between February - May as this is the dry season and the most reliable time of year to see tigers, before the temperatures get too hot and not nice to be on safari in and of course before the monsoon comes and the tiger reserves close.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.

• Visit the park morning and afternoon as well as having the chance to stay inside the park on one occasion and also enjoy spotlighting after dark around the buffer zone to Satpura and spending an overnight in the bufferzone in Jhinna Jungle Camp run by Ken River Lodge.
• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and tiger safaris of India a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. This tour starts and ends in the historical city of Delhi, and the tour visits two different tiger reserves. Firstly Satpura and then Panna and when in Panna you will stay in a special camp in the bufferzone of the park.
