dayInfo.description: Delhi - Arrival On arrival at Delhi international airport you will be met by your local guide/driver and transferred to your hotel and no activities are scheduled today. (no meals included).

Satpura National Park - Travelling Today you will be transferred to the domestic airport for your flight to Bhopal. We will have breakfast or lunch (depending on the flight arrival time) in Bhopal before continuing onwards to Reni Pani Jungle Lodge and on arrival here, you will check in and have your evening meal. (breakfast and dinner are included today).

Delhi - Travelling This morning you will be free to rest and have a lie in before breakfast. Then you will be taken to the airport in Bhopal and catch a flight back to Delhi. Once we arrive in Delhi you will be transferred to your hotel for the night. (breakfast only included).

Panna National Park - Travelling Today you will be transferred to the domestic airport for your flight to Khajuraho. We will have lunch in Khajurahi before continuing onwards to the Ken River Lodge and on arrival here, you will check in and have your evening meal. (breakfast and dinner only included).

Panna National Park - Wildlife Watching Today you will enter Panna National Park twice. You can choose between jeep safaris or boat trips down the Ken River, we recommend jeep safaris as they cover more ground and will enable you to see a larger area of the park and have better chances of seeing wildlife. Along with the abundant wildlife in the park which includes a small population of tigers, there are ample other attractions to see including many waterfalls and numerous ancient cultural relics dotted around the park. Many people regard Panna National Park to be one of the most aesthetically beautiful parks in all of India. On return to Delhi you will be transferred to your hotel and have your farewell evening meal and go over your experience of Panna and Jhinna. (breakfast is the only meal included).
Home This morning you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is included).

tourName: India safari holiday, lions tigers & bears
generalInfo:
Lions, tigers & bears, oh my! Throw on your ruby slippers for this fantastical trip through the jungle that will leave you feeling, “There’s no place like India”! This magical itinerary will see you discover some of India’s most inspiring National Parks and Tiger Reserves on a search for unparalleled wildlife encounters and dreamlike landscapes. India is home to an incredible diversity of wildlife, with almost 10% of the world’s wildlife species calling it home, including 15 species of wildcat and 4 of the world’s 8 species of bear! Your itinerary will focus mainly on observing 3 of these big cats (the Asiatic Lion, Bengal Tiger and the Indian Leopard), and the endemic Sloth bear, and will visit the parks and reserves most renowned for sightings of these unique creatures. You will explore through Gir National Park, Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve, Pench Tiger Reserve and Satpura Tiger Reserve, enjoying multiple jeep safaris and activities designed to get you up-close to this magnificent wildlife.

Staying in high standard accommodation throughout, and with private transfers and internal flights this is the ultimate Indian jungle safari itinerary.

Toto, I’ve got a feeling we’re not in Kansas anymore…

Highlights:

- Search for Asiatic lions in Gir National Park, Bengal tigers in Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve, Indian leopards and Dholes in Pench Tiger Reserve and Sloth bears and Gaurs in Satpura Tiger Reserve
- Encounter various other wildlife species including the endemic rusty-spotted cat, four horned antelopes, jackals, striped hyenas, Indian wolves and much more
- Abundant birdlife
- Private jeep safaris included in each Park or Reserve
- Enjoy a half-day tour of vibrant New Delhi
- High standard accommodation and private transfers throughout

Accommodations:

- 1 night at the Lemon Tree Premiere, Aerocity on a Bed & Breakfast basis
- 3 nights at Gir Birding Lodge with all meals included
- 1 night at Le Meridien Nagpur on a Bed & Breakfast basis
- 3 nights at Bamboo Forest Safari Lodge with all meals included
- 2 nights at Pench Tree Lodge with all meals included
- 3 nights at Reni Pani Jungle Lodge with all meals included

Activities Included:

- Half-Day Delhi City Tour
- 4 Private Jeep Safaris in Gir National Park
- 5 Private Jeep Safaris in the Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve
- 2 Private Jeep Safaris and 1 Night Safari in Pench Tiger Reserve
- 4 Private Jeep Safaris, 1 Dusk/Night Drive and 1 Canoe or Walking Safari in Satpura Tiger Reserve

dayInfo.description: Delhi: Your itinerary begins in Delhi where you will be greeted by your tour representative and transferred to your hotel in Aerocity New Delhi. This afternoon you can enjoy an included half-day city tour designed to showcase the diverse heritage of India’s capital city. Accommodation: 1 night’s accommodation at the Lemon Tree Premiere, Aerocity on a Bed & Breakfast basis. Activities Included: Half-Day City Tour

Fly to Rajkot: After a late breakfast this morning you will transfer to the domestic airport for an included afternoon flight to Rajkot. The flight duration is just under 2 hours. Upon arrival in Rajkot your tour representative will greet you and transfer you by road (approx. 4 hour drive) to the Gir Birding Lodge on the boundary of the fantastic Gir National Park and Wildlife Sanctuary. Accommodation: 3 nights’ accommodation at Gir Birding Lodge with all meals included. Activities Included During Your Stay: 4 Private Jeep Safaris in Gir National Park

Gir National Park: Over the next two days your search for sightings of the Asiatic Lion will begin as you explore the magnificent Gir National Park, the only place in the world where Asiatic Lions can be spotted in the wild. It is also the only place in the world where lions and tigers coexist in the wild. Two private jeep safaris have been organised for you for each day you are here. The Park has many tourist routes and your route taken will be allocated at the start of each safari. Early morning, morning and afternoon slots are available, and we recommend taking up the options for early morning and afternoon drives as sometimes there can be less wildlife activity during the peak of the day. As well as searching for the Asiatic Lions that roam here, there are also great chances of spotting leopards within the park along with Sambar, the largest Indian deer, Chowsingha, the world’s only four horned antelope, jackals, striped hyenas, India foxes and a multitude of birds and reptiles.

Fly to Nagpur: After an early breakfast this morning, you will take your transfer to Rajkot airport for your included flight to Nagpur, via Indore. After a long day of travelling, your tour representative will greet you at Nagpur airport and transfer you to Le Meridien Hotel for a well-deserved rest. Accommodation: 1 night’s stay at Le Meridien Nagpur on a Bed & Breakfast basis.

Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve: After breakfast on the morning of day 6, you will take your approximately 2.5 hour road transfer to the Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve where you will check in to the beautiful Bamboo Forest Safari Lodge. The remainder of the morning will be at your leisure, before your exploration of Tadoba begins. Over the next few days, your exploration of the area will largely be targeted on seeking out sightings of the Bengal Tigers that are found in great numbers here. Out of all the parks you will visit on your tour, Tadoba holds the highest probability of viewing these iconic animals. During your time here you can enjoy up to 5 included jeep safaris designed to offer the best wildlife viewing opportunities. As well as the Bengal Tigers, you can also hope for sightings of other enigmatic animals such as the Indian leopards, sloth bears, dhole, hyenas, spotted deer and much more that reside here, along with an incredibly rare melanistic leopard that roams the park. Accommodation: 3 nights’ accommodation at Bamboo Forest Safari Lodge with all meals included. Activities Included During Your Stay: 5 Private Jeep Safaris in the Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve.

Pench Tiger Reserve: On the morning of day 9, after an early breakfast, you will transfer by road (approximately 4 hour drive) to the famous Pench Tiger Reserve and Pench National Park where you will check into the excellent Pench Tree Lodge by lunchtime. After lunch you can begin your exploration of the reserve, with 2 private jeep safaris and a night safari included during your stay here. The park derives its name from the Pench River which runs through it and supports a wide variety of wildlife. It is one of the most popular wildlife reserves in India and is even mentioned in Rudyard Kipling’s ‘The Jungle Book’. Our focus here will be particularly upon the Indian Leopards and tigers which reside here, along with gaur, one of the tallest bovines in the world. Tourists also tend to flock here to spot the famous characters from The Jungle Book including Akela (The Indian Wolf), Raksha (the female Wolf), Baloo (Sloth Bear), and the vicious Shere Khan (Royal Bengal Tiger). Other sightings may include wild boar, striped hyena, monkeys, four-horned antelopes, jackals and much more. During your night safari you can also hope for sightings of flying foxes, flying squirrels and more tigers and leopards. Accommodation: 2 nights’ accommodation at Pench Tree Lodge with all meals included. Activities Included During Your Stay: 2 Private Jeep Safaris and 1 Night Safari in Pench Tiger Reserve.

Satpura Tiger Reserve: Your last park to discover on your Indian wildlife adventure is the beautiful Satpura Tiger Reserve which you will transfer to on the morning of day 11. After an approximately 6 hour drive, you will arrive at the wonderful Reni Pani Jungle Lodge where the rest of the day will be at your leisure. After the long drive you may simply want to relax within the comforts of your lodge, or you could join a dusk/night time drive through the reserve which is included as part of your package. Nighttime drives here are highly recommended as they offer excellent chances of spotting species such as rusty-spotted cats (one of the world’s smallest wildcat species which is endemic to the Indian subcontinent), sloth bears (also endemic), Chausinghas (four-horned antelopes), leopards, a variety of owls, and nightjars. You may also be lucky enough to spot tigers at night. Over the next 2 days you can enjoy your included jeep safaris through the reserve in search of sightings of the area’s iconic wildlife. Entering the park is an adventure in itself as you transfer to the river front to take a motorboat across into the core forest where your safari jeep will be waiting to collect you. As this is one of the best places in India to see sloth bears, your safaris will have a focus on finding them and the chances are very high. Leopard sightings in the park are excellent too, however, over the last 3-4 years we have seen a rise in tiger numbers which had made the other stars of Satpura a little shyer since they are no longer the top predators. Indian giant squirrels are another unique species that can be found here. During your time here you can also enjoy an included canoe safari or walking safari. The canoe safaris offer excellent birdwatching opportunities as well as sightings of crocodiles and the land mammals that come down to the water to drink. Walking safaris are a great way to get closer to the smaller fauna that is often too well camouflaged to be seen during jeep safaris. Accommodation: 3 nights’ accommodation at Reni Pani Jungle Lodge with all meals included. Activities Included During Your Stay: 4 Private Jeep Safaris, 1 Dusk/Night Drive and 1 Canoe or Walking Safari in Satpura Tiger Reserve.

Return to Delhi - End of Tour: On your final morning you can enjoy a last jeep safari into the reserve with breakfast provided, before returning to the lodge to freshen up, check out and transfer by road to Bhopal airport to catch your flight to Delhi. Upon arrival back in Delhi a representative will greet you and help you to transfer to the international terminal.

tourName: India specialist tiger safari tour, 3 weeks
generalInfo:
The most famous predator in India if not the whole world, is of course the iconic and majestic Tiger. And when it comes to seeing this amazing animal there really is only one place; central India.

There are a number of national parks and tiger reserves around India (over 40 in total) and many are in the central state of Madhya Pradesh, it is here where some of the reserves boast such a huge percentage of the world population its hard not to find tigers.

This safari is by far the most comprehensive tiger safari around; travelling to three of the best parks in the world for tigers and spending three weeks searching for them we could easily spot over 25 different tigers during our time here. But its not just tigers there are dhole, sloth bears, leopards, langurs, chital, sambar, golden jackals, jungle cats and many more mammals and birds.

We enter the parks with a local guide and driver, travel between the parks in private air conditioned vehicles and stay in the best lodges around the parks.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of Indian wildlife watching safari holidays. These tours range from the dry desert regions of Gujarat in search of striped hyena and Asiatic lions to the icy peaks of the Himalayas on the quest for snow leopards. But we also focus heavily on some of the 40 plus Tiger Reserves in this wonderful and diverse country. But it is not just the wildlife of India that makes India such a great holiday destination, but the varied and unique culture is also a focus for our trips.

This tour is a specialist tiger safari of three of the best locations in the world for tigers and a host of other large mammals in India. Panna, Bandhavgarh and Kanha National Parks. These parks have a population of over 200 tigers and some of the highest densities of wild tigers in the world. As well as the large population of tigers the park is also home to a great range of other species of predators, which are seen more readily here than many other locations in India. These are leopards, dhole and sloth bear. These predators live alongside their prey such as guar, barasingha, chital, sambar, wild boar and many other species.

Because this tour is mainly focused on tigers and only visits national parks in central India you can add on extensions to also visit many of the cultural highlights such as the Taj Mahal or Old Delhi. If you are interested in adding on more to this Tiger Safari please let us know.

Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

This tour is recommended for February - May as this is the dry season and the chances of seeing tigers is much higher in the dry season. However the temperatures from April onward can be very hot and humid. You can visit this park and enjoy the itinerary between October – June. The park is closed during the monsoon season.

• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and tiger safaris of India a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout India so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the tigers, leopards, sloth bears, dhole and many more species. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of India at other times of year and focusing on other species such as brown and snow leopards, Indian one-horned rhinos, Western Ghats endemics, elephants, primates, Asiatic lions and many species throughout this incredible country. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.

Locations:

This tour is completely focused on three national parks and tiger reserves all located in the Central Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. With Delhi being the main arrival and departure hub.

Fitness Level:

The vast majority of wildlife watching is all done from a vehicle. So no physical fitness for hiking or anything like that is needed. This is a very easy trip to undertake.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 12 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Delhi - Arrival On arrival at the Delhi international airport, you will be met by your local guide/driver. We will then transfer you to our hotel, level 3* (Hotel Rockland / Hotel Florence Inn). Delhi, was once the capital of kingdoms and empires and is now a sprawling metropolis with a fascinating blend of the past and the present. It is a perfect introduction to the composite culture of an ancient land. Depending on the time of arrival we will spend some time exploring the city. (no meals are included today).

Panna National Park - Travelling & Sightseeing After breakfast we will be transferred to Delhi domestic airport to catch the short (2.40 hours) flight to Khajuraho. When we arrive here you will be met by your local guide/driver and depending on the time of the flight we will spend some time sightseeing here. Khajuraho is well known for its magnificent temples, which were built between 950 and 1050 A.D. Khajuraho derives its name from the Khajur tree (the date palm tree), which can be found in abundance in the area. The divine sculptures in these temples are a tribute to Life itself, embodying everything that is sublime and spontaneous about it. The murals depict the life and times of the Chandelas, and celebrate the erotic state of being. They not only testify to the mastery of the craftsman, but also to the extraordinary breadth of vision of the Chandela Rajputs under whose reign, these temples were constructed. After lunch we either visit the Eastern and Western groups of Temples or we will travel direct to our accommodation at Panna National Park, level – safari lodge (Ken River Lodge) (1 hour). Once again depending on the time of arrival we may head into the park on an afternoon jeep safari to try and find some wildlife. Panna National Park is an excellent place to find leopards. Our evening meal will be at our accommodation and an early night is recommended as tomorrow is a busy and exciting day. (breakfast and dinner are the only meals included today).

Bandhvgarh National Park - Travelling & Wildlife Watching Depending on the road conditions we will either rise early once again for our last visit into the national park before breakfast or we will rise a little later enjoy breakfast before driving over to Bandhavgarh National Park (5 hours) in our private air conditioned vehicle. If we have left early enough we will head into the park for our first jeep safari here after lunch at the accommodation or we if we have already had a jeep safari this morning we will have to see if we get to Bandhavgarh in time for an afternoon safari. Bandhavgarh National Park is set amongst the Vindhya Hills in Madhya Pradesh, and has a mixture of bamboo, grassland, and a complex of deciduous forests. There are at least 150 species of birds in the park, along with other mammals such as tigers, sloth bears, langur monkeys, wild boar, mongooses, 3 kinds of deer – chital, sambar and Indian muntjac, to name a few. Once a hunting reserve of the royal family of Rewa in more recent times, Bandhavgarh was declared a park in 1968. This is also the site where the famous white tigers of Rewa were discovered. And this national park has the highest density of tigers anywhere in the world. (all meals included today).

Kanha National Park - Travelling & Tiger Safaris Today will start off the same as the past few days but after the morning safari and breakfast we will leave Bandhavgarh National Park in our private air conditioned vehicle to Kanha National Park (6 hours). We will grab some lunch along the way and once we arrive at our new lodge we will have our evening meal and you are free to enjoy the rest of the evening at your leisure as we relax after a long drive and some exciting safaris into Panna and Bandhavgarh and he will explain the difference expected in Kanha. (all of your meals will be included on these days).

Jabalpur - Tiger Safari & Travelling Today will once again start off with a morning safari and the possibility of a breakfast picnic in the park if conditions are good. Once we are back and packed we will leave for Jabalpur (4.5-5 hours) in our private air conditioned vehicle. After checking into our hotel and lunch there will be a late afternoon excursion to Bhedaghat to see the Marble Rocks, Duandhar Falls and Chausath Yogini Temple as well as having a boat ride on the Narmada River. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

Delhi - Travelling Today after breakfast we will be taken to Jabalpur airport in time to catch the flight back to Delhi, our evening meal will be at our Delhi hotel. (breakfast is the only meal included today).
Home - Departure Today we will be transferred to Delhi international airport after breakfast to catch our return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

tourName: India tiger safari and wildlife tour
generalInfo:
This tour visits some of the greatest parks and wilderness areas in the whole of the Indian Subcontinent; firstly Kanha; this is one of the best places in the world to see wild tigers. But the park is also one of the most aesthetically beautiful and home to some very rare species that are not seen in other parks such as dhole and barasingha.

You then travel north and east to the vast and lush grasslands of the Indian terai, this lowland ecosystem is fed from by monsoon waters from the south and Himalayan meltwater from the north. Making these alluvial soils some of the most fertile in the world. These grasslands now support 75% of the world’s population of Indian one-horned rhinos as well as large populations of Asiatic elephants, water buffalo and tigers. All of which help to make Kaziranga one of the most popular parks for wildlife film makers and enthusiasts alike.

From here you travel to the massive city of Kolkata and then onto the Indian side of the Sundarbans. The largest mangrove forest in the world is home of the world’s largest populations of endangered tigers and Gangetic river dolphins in the world. From this pristine and incredible ecosystem. This is a unique tiger safari that explores three very distinct habitats that the tigers lives in, the forests of Kanha, the grasslands of Kaziranga and the mangroves of the Sundarbans.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of Indian wildlife watching safari holidays. These tours range from the dry desert regions of Gujarat in search of striped hyena and Asiatic lions to the icy peaks of the Himalayas on the quest for snow leopards. But we also focus heavily on some of the 40 plus Tiger Reserves in this wonderful and diverse country. But it is not just the wildlife of India that makes India such a great holiday destination, but the varied and unique culture is also a focus for our trips.

This tour is a specialist tiger safari is unique in that we visit three different national parks which also cover three very different habitats of the tiger in India. The most commonly associated habitat being the sal forests and meadows of Central India which are best exemplified in Kanha National Park. The next is the very diverse elephant grass floodplains of the terai and then the world's largest mangrove ecosystem and the strangest habitat of the tiger.

By visiting these diverse habitats you will see the tiger's conservation and evolutionary story told from different angles and gain a far better insight into the amazing world of the tiger than on many other tiger safaris.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in Delhi and Kolkata. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through India and particularly Kanha, Kaziranga and the Sundarbans. Your naturalist escort is an expert in tigers and their conservation and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. We will also employ a specific cultural guide for all sightseeing of temples and monuments.

The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, river safaris, spotlighting, guided walks, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

This tour is recommended for February - May as this is the dry season and the chances of seeing tigers is much higher in the dry season. However the temperatures from April onward can be very hot and humid. You can visit this park and enjoy the itinerary between October – June. The parks are closed during the monsoon season.

• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and tiger safaris of India a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. This tour visits three different parks which are spread all over India, firstly the Central Indian park of Kanha and then up to the North East and Kaziranga before the Bay of Bengal and the wonderful Sundarbans, Your entry point will be Delhi and you will exit in Kolkata.

dayInfo.description: Delhi - Arrival - Today you will be met by your guide on arrival at Delhi international airport and transferred to the hotel in downtown Delhi. The rest of the day is free for you to rest however you can speak to your guide about arranging a short city sightseeing tour if you wish. (no meals included today).

Delhi - Kanha National Park - Travelling - Today you will take a packed breakfast from the hotel as you will be leaving early to catch our flight to Jabalpur. Once we arrive you will met our local driver and begin the 4 hour drive or so south to Kanha National park. Kanha National Park is one of the largest and most scenic national parks in India, it has an ideal habitat for both tigers and their prey species. The lush sal and bamboo forests, grassy meadows and ravines of Kanha shel­ter a significant population of rare species such as tiger, leopard, sloth bear, barasingha, gaur and dhole. Once we arrive at Kanha National Park we will check into our accommodation which is the beautiful and highly recommended Chitvan Jungle Lodge. This discreet lodge blends into the sur­rounding countryside and provides a beautiful location for exploring the park over the next 4 days. (breakfast and dinner are included today).

Kanha National Park - Delhi - Travelling - This morning after breakfast you will be picked up by the local driver again and drive back to Jabalpur. Where we will catch a flight back to Delhi, unfortu­nately there is no direct flight from here to near Kaziranga. So we will spend the night in Delhi, back at the boutique Visaya Hotel. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

Delhi - Kaziranga National Park - Travelling Today is a long day of travelling, you will leave early for Delhi domestic airport with a packed break­fast in order to catch your first flight of the day and travel to Kolkata. You then connect to your next flight to Jorhat , Jorhat is the closest airport to Kaziranga but you will still have 2-3 hours of driving from Jorhat to the resort at Kaziranga. Once you arrive at the resort you will have the rest of the afternoon and evening to relax after checking in. The resort is nestled amidst rolling hills of lush green tea gardens and offers typical Assamese hospitality and food. Tomorrow we will have an early start as we head into the park for the first time and after a long day of lots of travelling an early night and good night’s sleep is the best tonic. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

Kaziranga National Park - Kolkata - Travelling This morning you will leave Kaziranga and drive towards Guhawati or Jorhat (depending on the best available flight schedule) and catch your flight to Kolkata. On arrival you will be taken to your hotel for the night. The rest of the day is free for your leisure. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

Kolkata - Sundarbans - Travelling After an early breakfast you will be taken to eastwards towards the world’s largest mangrove forest, the Sundarbans. On arrival here you will taken to your lodge located in the heart of the mangroves and depending on the time of arrival you will either have the rest of the day to rest or be taken to on an afternoon boat cruise through some of the narrow rivers and tributaries. Recent studies suggest that the Sundarbans has the highest density of tigers in the world and a large population (330-500), making it one of the most important populations of tigers in the world along with the Russian Far East and the continuous forests of South East Asia. However seen one of these tigers is difficult, we will however see many other species over the next couple of days here. (breakfast and dinner included today).

Sundarbans - Kolkata - Travelling - This morning after breakfast you will depart from the Sundarbans and travel back to the metropolis of Kolkata and your hotel for your last night in India. (breakfast is the only meal included today).
Home - Departure After breakfast you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

tourName: India tiger safari holiday, Satpura & Pench
generalInfo:
The Indian sub-continent is home to some of the world’s most extraordinary wild landscapes. India now has as many as 2,967 tigers in the wild, with more than half of them in Madhya Pradesh and Karnataka, according to the tiger estimation report for 2018.
India with 50 tiger reserves in 18 states has over 80% of the global tiger population.
This “Call of the wild” is an amazing treat for nature lovers as the National Parks included in this program are fantastic tiger spots and offer good chance to spot them besides other flora and fauna. This is wildlife so sightings can never be guaranteed !! Keep your focused and you may just spot one…

To experience wildlife we have included rides in shared jeeps along with English speaking naturalist.

Highlights :
- Satpura National Park
- Pench National Park
- Shared jeep safaris to visit National Parks
- Stay on full board (breakfast + lunch + dinner)
- Train journey in India for an extra ordinary experience and avoiding flight.
- One domestic flight within India

Note :
- Prices are applicable till 30th June 2024. However, these are not applicable during peak period - generally during festival period in India like Diwali and Holi and also from 20 Dec to 10 Jan. If your travel is happening during these dates, please let us know your dates of travel to quote you prices accordingly.
- Prices are based on present park entry & safari fee. If park authorities will increase the the park entry & safari fee then the prices will be revised accordingly. At the time of your inquiry / booking, we will inform you about exact rates applicable for this tour.
- Morning safari is from 6 am-11.30 am approx. and Afternoon safari is from 2.30 pm -6 pm approx.
- Wednesday afternoon Park is closed. Also during Diwali and Holi festival Park is closed for full day.
-This program starts with arrival in Delhi and then proceeding to Central India. We have not included stay / cost after dropping you at airport on Day 9. You have option of coming back to Delhi or continue to Mumbai or join this program with Golden Triangle (Delhi - Jaipur - Agra)..cost for tour arrangements after Nagpur on Day 9 would be extra. Let us know your preference and plans !!

dayInfo.description: Arrive Delhi

Delhi / Bhopal (by train - 06.00 / 14.10 am) Early morning transfer to railway station to board day train to Bhopal. Arrival at Bhopal, check in at Jehan Numa Retreat (luxury room) for late lunch. Afternoon Excursion to Sanchi, a Buddhist complex, famous for its Great Stupa. Dinner and overnight.

Bhopal / Reni Pani Jungle Lodge Morning short visit of Bhopal and continue towards Madhai. The drive will take you a little under 4 hours. Check In at Reni Pani Jungle Lodge (luxury room) in time for a late lunch. Evening Canoe safari on the Tawa Reservoir. Dinner and overnight.

Satpura National Park Early Morning wake up and head for a Safari into the Satpura National park. On safaris breakfast are in the forest. Return to the lodge for lunch. Evening head for a Jungle walk, a good time to see animals that are active at dusk with one of our star naturalists. Return to the lodge in time for dinner.

Reni Pani Jungle Lodge / Bori Safari Lodge Early morning departure from the lodge for an exciting transfer through the Satpura Tiger Reserve, literally driving through the park the whole day to Bori Safari Lodge. Lunch will be served at Churna Forest House. This cross country drive through the reserve is an experience in itself giving you the rare opportunity to experience the jungle. Arrive at Bori Safari Lodge (luxury room) by evening. Check-in and a brief rest followed by an early dinner.

Bori Safari Lodge Morning at Leisure, opt for a Village / Nature walk followed by breakfast at the lodge. Day to relax and afternoon safari to the Jhalai Buffer Area Drive. Back at the lodge for Dinner and overnight.

Bori Safari Lodge / Jamtara Wilderness Camp Breakfast at the lodge and depart for Jamtara which will take around 4 hours. Arrive at Jamtara Wilderness Camp (tent) in time for Lunch. Afternoon at leisure or option for a village walk to the Jamtara village. This village is quite special to the team , from its people to the different activities that took place while our set up took place. Being so remote from any major city, the rural villages that surround us use minimal means of transportation, electronics, and machines, truly transporting you back in time. . Dinner and Stay overnight at Jamtara Wilderness Camp.

Jamtara Wilderness Camp Wake up for an early morning safari into Pench National Park. The Teak forest of Pench, allows you to see much deeper, hence keep your binoculars ready. There is opportunity to see Tigers, Leopards, Wild Dogs, Sloth Bears, Gaur to name a few. And ofcourse over 200 species of birds. You will return to camp approximately by 11 AM after breakfast in the Park. Afternoon free at leisure, you may take a walk through the buffer forest or pick up a cycle to explore around on your own. Lunch and Dinner will be at Camp.
Transfer to Nagpur to connect flight to Delhi or Mumbai. Early breakfast and transfer to the Nagpur airport for your flight home. The drive to Nagpur airport will take about 3 hours.

tourName: India tiger safari in Corbett NP
generalInfo:
This tour will explore one of the oldest national parks in the world, India's very first national park. Established by one of the most prominent and famous big game hunters in all of Asia. Jim Corbett decided to protect a huge area of sub-Himalayan belt in North West India in 1936.

His main aim was to protect the animals he was paid well to hunt, the tigers and leopards of this region were dying out quickly here and with a growing human population he was determined to protect the wildlife and ecosystem he had come to know, love and respect with passion and enthusiasm.

Since then the park has changed names and been expanded but the wildlife is still exceptional. With over 100 tigers resident to the surrounding area, a mix of lowland and sub-Himalayan species and 600 plus bird species recorded, Corbett National Park is a must for all wildlife lovers visiting India.

The combination of habitats which are more familiar to Central India, some terai habitat from the fertile floodplain belt in the sub-Himalayas as well as forested hills means that the there is a large diversity of wildlife here. Animals which are not found in the same areas elsewhere in India can be found here such as Asiatic black bears, tigers, Asiatic elephants and gharials.

But it is not just the wildlife of India that makes India such a great holiday destination, but the varied and unique culture is also a focus for our trips.

This tour is a specialist tiger safari of one of the most interesting national parks in India. There is a large population of tigers here as well as elephants and many other iconic species from India. One of the most interesting species found here which is very rare is the large crocodilian the gharial.

Because this tour is only focused on Corbett National Park you can add on extensions to also visit many of the cultural highlights such as the Taj Mahal or Old Delhi. If you are interested in adding on more to this Indian Tiger Safari please let us know.

dayInfo.description: Delhi - Arrival Once you arrive into Delhi international airport you will be met by your local guide and driver and then be transferred to your hotel in the city. If your flight arrived in the morning you can enjoy some sightseeing today. (no meals included today).

Corbett National Park - Travelling This morning you will be collected from your hotel in Delhi and transfered to Corbett National Park. Corbett is located around 250km north-east of Delhi in the sub-Himalayan Sivalik hills. The drive is around 4-5 hours and along the way the highway crosses the famous Ganges River and as this is the closest point of the river to Delhi so that it can get busy with worshippers. Once you arrive at the park and your lodge you will check in and then if time allows you will be taken on a short afternoon jeep safari into the buffer-zone of the park. This is a brief introduction to some of the wildlife in the area and you should see barking deer, wild boar and chital as well as many species of the commoner bird species such as crested serpent eagles, blossom-headed parakeets, pied kingfishers, dollarbirds and Asian paradise flycatchers. During this short safari you will cross the wonderful Ramganga River, this is a monsoonal river that is the lifeblood of the surrounding areas you will see how most people’s lives revolve around the river. After this you will be taken back to the accommodation to relax and enjoy your evening meal. (breakfast and dinner included).

Corbett National Park - Wildlife Watching This morning you can have another jeep safari before breakfast, this would be your last chance of seeing hog deer that love the grasslands around here, then after breakfast you will board the jeep and head back towards the town of Ramnagar along the Ramganga River, this is the dry season so the river will be low and you will see the huge rounded boulders that have been brought here from high in the distance Himalayas over thousands of years of spring melts and monsoonal floods. It is a shame that the park is closed during the monsoon season as it must be incredible to see this mighty river in full flow during this time of year. Along the way you have the chance of seeing more wildlife for the last time before arriving back at the lodge and your evening meal. (all meals included today).
Delhi - Travelling This morning you will leave the lodge after breakfast and be transferred back to Delhi and your hotel for the last night in India. (breakfast is the only meal included today).
Home - Departure After breakfast you will be transferred to the international airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

tourName: India tiger safari in Kanha National Park
generalInfo:
This budget tiger safari of India takes you to one of the best national parks in the country; Kanha National Park. This park is a wonderful mix of grassy plateaus, open misty plains and bamboo forests and is home to around a hundred tigers living wild. As well as dhole, guar, leopard, sambhar, chital and monkeys and dozens more species.

This budget safari has been designed to maximise your time in the park and chances of seeing tigers with as low a cost as possible. We are proud of our 100% sighting rate and of course, you will also get a chance to see a wide array of other wildlife, not just tigers. Please note that we are very happy to organise this trip for a solo traveller as well as for groups.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of Indian wildlife watching safari holidays. These tours range from the dry desert regions of Gujarat in search of striped hyena and Asiatic lions to the icy peaks of the Himalayas on the quest for snow leopards. But we also focus heavily on some of the 40 plus Tiger Reserves in this wonderful and diverse country. One of these reserves is Kanha National Park, a popular and large park with a huge number of tigers inhabiting inside it – but without the large numbers of tourists that can be found in the more popular and well known parks.

This tour explores this great park on the trail of tigers of course, this iconic denizen of the Indian jungles is as symbolic of India as the Taj Mahal or Mahatma Ghandi. But Kanha has a fantastic record for also showing the other predators of the jungle. Whilst rare and hard to see in other parks the leopards, sloth bears and dhole are all regularly seen here. So we will dedicate a large amount time to these species as well as the tigers whilst here.

Kanha is one of India's more popular parks, however we have an incredible range of safaris in India. Whether you wish to visit the Western Ghats for its endemic species, Gujarat for the desert adapted species, the high grasslands of the North East for giants such as rhinos, elephants and buffalo or even head to the Himalayas for snow leopard spotting we have the itinerary for you. India is a treasure trove of wildlife and habitats and all you have to do is to get in touch with your budget and your group size and where you would like to go and we will come back to you with an itinerary and quote for your perfect Indian wildlife safari tour.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in Delhi. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through India and particularly Kanha. Your naturalist escort is an expert in tigers and their conservation and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing.

The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

The best time to go tiger watching in India is mid January to mid May. This is the hot dry season with the hottest time from beginning March until mid May. This is when tigers come out to waterholes to find water, or prey on other wildlife doing the same.
However you can visit this park and enjoy the itinerary between November – April.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge..
• Our local Indian guides around Kanha have a good relationship with the park officials and because of this we get a heads up when animals are sighted and this can guide us in where to focus and thus increasing our chances of seeing our targeted species.
• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and tiger safaris of India a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout India so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the tigers, leopards, sloth bears, dhole and many more species. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of India at other times of year and focusing on other species such as brown and snow leopards, Indian one-horned rhinos, Western Ghats endemics, elephants, primates, Asiatic lions and many species throughout this incredible country. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour is completely focused on one national park and tiger reserve, Kanha. It is located in Madhya Pradesh. We will fly in and out of Delhi and then travel onto Jabaplur before reaching the park in the Indian wilderness.

Fitness Level:

All of this safari is done from a vehicle. So no physical fitness for hiking or anything like that is needed. This is a very easy trip to undertake.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 15 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Jabalpur - Today you will arrive into the city of Jabalpur in Madhya Pradesh. On arrival you will be met by your local guide and taken direct towards Kanha National Park. The rest of the day will be free for you to rest and relax and tomorrow you head into the park for your first day of safaris. (Breakfast and dinner included today).

Kanha National Park - Travelling & Safari - After an early breakfast this morning you will leave the hotel to Kanha National park (4.5-5 hrs) in a private vehicle. On your arrival at the park you will check into your lodge and then in the afternoon head into the park for your first jeep safari. Every time you enter the park you will be accompanied by a national park naturist and local drive; so you will be in good company when looking for wildlife. (Breakfast and dinner only).

Kanha National Park / Jabalpur - Safari & Travelling - This morning you will have one last jeep safari into Kanha before breakfast back at the lodge. You will then travel back to Jabalpur (4.5-5 hours). This afternoon is free for you to rest and relax. (Breakfast only).
Home - Departure - Today after breakfast we will be taken to Jabalpur airport in time to catch the flight back to home. (Breakfast only).

tourName: India tiger safari small group holiday
generalInfo:
Journey into the heartland of India in search of the majestic Royal Bengal Tiger. On this 15-day tour, we take in five sprawling national parks, spotting tigers, dolphins, gharials and sambar dear amongst others. Soak in the astounding scenery as we travel by boat and 4WD vehicles through the forests, rivers and mountains of central India.

Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve - Search for tigers in Bandhavgarh, boasting the highest population density of tigers in the world.
Kanha National Park - Spot wildlife on jeep safaris through Kanha, the inspiration for Rudyard Kipling's 'Jungle Book'.
Panna, Sariska and Chambal - Explore the rocky Aravalli Hills, boat along the River Chambal and drive through the forests of the lesser-known Panna.

dayInfo.title: Join trip in Delhi. Evening prayer ceremony at Hanuman Temple
dayInfo.description: : Arrive in New Delhi, the capital of India and the colourful, bustling centre of the nation. The city has been at the heart of numerous empires and dynasties over time from the Mughals to the British Raj, with each one having left its own unique mark on the city, resulting in the rich patchwork that is modern-day Delhi. For those arriving on time today, our tour leader plans to meet you in the hotel reception at 5pm for a welcome meeting. We'll then make our way out into the city on foot, arriving at Hanuman's Temple in time to witness the evening prayer rituals. Afterwards, we'll explore the bustling hub of Connaught Place - a colonial-era circus of shops, bars, restaurants and street vendors. If you'd like an airport transfer today, you'll need to arrive into New Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport (DEL), which is around 45 minutes from our hotel. Please note, that if you'd like to join the city tour today, you'll need to arrive at the hotel by 4pm. If you're booking your own flights, we recommend giving yourself at least one hour to clear the airport. The drive from the airport to the hotel is then around 45 minutes, therefore the latest your flight can arrive is 2pm. If you miss the welcome meeting, your tour leader will inform you of any essential information as soon as you catch up.

dayInfo.title: Explore the sights of New Delhi including Humayun's Tomb, then drive to Sariska
dayInfo.description: : This morning, we'll explore more of the city, acclimatising ourselves to the calmer area of New Delhi, and driving along the wide avenues to take in the major sights that begin to tell the story of India's rich history. We visit India Gate and the UNESCO-listed Mughal site of Humayun's Tomb, a precursor to the great Taj Mahal. After lunch, we leave Delhi and drive to Sariska National Park, a drive of approximately three and a half hours. There will be some free time in the late afternoon to enjoy our lodge's facilities before dinner.

dayInfo.title: Morning and afternoon game drives searching for wildlife in Sariska National Park
dayInfo.description: : Sariska National Park has been a real success story of conservation. Back in the early 2000s, it was thought that due to poaching and habitat degradation, the reserve had no tigers left within its boundaries. A huge conservation effort was mounted and fast-forwarding to today there is now thought to be a population of around 30 tigers including a litter of healthy cubs. Straddling Rajasthan's Aravalli Hills, Sariska is characterised by dry deciduous forests, grasslands and rocky landscapes. The park is generally considered to be a far quieter park than its very popular neighbour, Ranthambore. As the sun rises and the dawn breaks, we head out early to catch our first glimpse of India's incredible wildlife. As well as the tigers, the park is also home to the elusive leopard, jungle cat, jackals, a variety of deer a huge number of langurs. After lunch, we take a second game drive as we continue to search for wildlife. The group will be split into a number of open-topped, private jeeps, with each jeep having an accompanying naturalist.

dayInfo.title: Drive to Dholpur to take a boat on the Chambal River to spot river-side wildlife
dayInfo.description: : This morning we will leave Rajasthan behind and cross into India's most populous state, Uttar Pradesh. Such is the population of UP, that if it were a country in its own right, it would be the fifth most populous country in the world. The state is a major industrial and commercial centre and, being on the main Indo-Gangetic plain, it benefits from rich soil for excellent agriculture. We make the five-hour drive across fertile landscapes to the city of Dholpur, sitting beside the Chambal River. The Chambal is one of the few remaining undammed rivers in northern India and is known for its rich biodiversity and relatively untouched natural surroundings. After lunch, we will take a private boat out onto the river where we hope to spot some of the rich variety of wildlife found here. This river is one of the last remaining habitats for the critically endangered Gharial, a species of long-snouted crocodile which are often found on the banks of the river, basking in the afternoon sun. As well as crocodiles, we may spot the playful Gangetic River Dolphin, smooth-coated otters or the Indian softshell turtle. The river is also a haven for birdlife where we hope to be lucky enough to spot Indian Skimmers, Sarus Cranes and Kingfishers. In the rare event that water levels in the Chambal River rise, Indian authorities may suspend river safaris for safety reasons, in which case an alternative activity will be provided.

dayInfo.title: Take a train to Jhansi, then drive to Khajuraho. Late afternoon free
dayInfo.description: : We head deeper into central India today, making the short drive to the train station this morning where we catch the two-hour train ride to Jhansi. Travelling by train is a wonderful way to experience India, from the bustling railway platforms to the chai wallahs that ply their trade through the carriages, offering hot tea and snacks along the journey. India has one of the largest rail networks in the world, and it serves as a vital lifeline for many Indians - connecting many small towns, villages and rural areas with larger commercial centres. Along the way, we can soak in the rural scenery as it rolls past our window and we're likely to get the chance to chat with some of the locals in our carriage who are often interested to see tourists travelling by train. After disembarking in Jhansi we will continue by bus, crossing into the central state of Madhya Pradesh to Khajuraho, a journey of around three hours. The rest of the afternoon has been left free to relax or to explore this ancient town.

dayInfo.title: Early morning game drive in Panna National Park. Afternoon visit to the Jain temples of Khajuraho
dayInfo.description: : We set off early this morning for our private 4WD game drive through the varied landscapes of Panna National Park. The park's topography provides some truly stunning scenery and makes it quite different from our experience in Sariska. The park is made up of thick teak forests separated by wide plateaus and gorges. The lazy Ken River flows through the park and acts as its main water source, and in parts cascades down stacked rocks forming impressive waterfalls. Known less for tigers (although sightings still can be made) the park is renowned for its birdlife with over 200 recorded species found here. Vultures and eagles are not uncommon sightings, as well as the colourful Asian Paradise Flycatcher; the state bird of Madhya Pradesh. Migratory birds are also prevalent in the winter months. Later this afternoon, we explore the UNESCO World Heritage Temples of Khajuraho. Intricately hand-carved, the erotic sculptures which adorn the Hindu and Jain temples here are full of symbolism and depict various aspects of life at the time, during the 9th to 12th century. We spend the afternoon exploring the main temples including the magnificent Kandariya Mahadev and Vishwanath temples.

dayInfo.title: Drive through rural countryside, past the farmlands of Madhya Pradesh to Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve
dayInfo.description: : Our journey continues today, as we drive further into the heart of India to Bandhavgarh - arguably the most famous tiger reserve in the world. The drive will take approximately five hours with breaks and will give us a real taste of rural India as we pass by patchworks of farmlands and pockets of small villages. It's a common scene in rural India to see children playing in the water from the hand-pumped wells, and cows and other livestock roaming freely through the villages and across the roads. Upon arrival in Bandhavgarh, the rest of the afternoon has been left free to relax.

dayInfo.title: Morning and afternoon game drives in Bandhavgarh National Park searching for the elusive Royal Bengal Tiger
dayInfo.description: : The former hunting reserve of the Maharaja of Rewa, Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve is today world-renowned for reputedly having the highest population density of tigers in any park on earth. The majestic Royal Bengal is at home here amongst the ideal habitat of high grasslands interspersed with forests of sal and bamboo, while rivers and streams crisscross their way through the park. The trees and high grasslands provide ample food for the park's large deer population, and in turn, provide plenty of cover for the tigers to hunt their prey. The various water sources are an ideal location for tigers to rest and a great place to spot the big cats lazing around on hotter days. Whilst tigers are the focus here, the park is also home to wild dogs, hyenas, spotted deer (chital), bison and many more species. We spend the day taking two safaris through the park, one in the early morning and one in the late afternoon. Safaris will be in private 4WD vehicles with a maximum of four to a jeep and with an accompanying naturalist.

dayInfo.title: Another morning and afternoon game drive in Bandhavgarh National Park
dayInfo.description: : We spend another day in Bandhavgarh, with two further morning and afternoon game drives in our private 4WD vehicles. Game drives are usually taken in the early morning, between the hours of 06.00 and 11.00 and afternoon game drives are between 14.30 and 17.30. The time in between can be spent at leisure, using the facilities of the lodge and enjoying an extended lunch break.

dayInfo.title: Drive from Bandhavgarh to Kanha National Park
dayInfo.description: : We leave Bandhavgarh National Park this morning and drive to Kanha, a journey of approximately six hours, with plenty of time for refreshment stops. We'll enjoy a late lunch on arrival at our jungle lodge, and the remainder of the afternoon is at leisure.

dayInfo.title: Morning and afternoon game drives searching for wildlife in Kanha National Park
dayInfo.description: : Kanha's huge expanses of grassy meadows and thick deciduous forests are said to have served as inspiration to Rudyard Kipling for The Jungle Book. It's easy to see why with the sheer variety on offer at Kanha, both for flora and fauna. The park is home to a significant population of tigers, as well as leopards, sloth bears, Bengal foxes, bison and the rare Indian antelope (blackbuck), as well as over 300 species of bird. The park is expansive, covering an area of 940 square kilometres and we plan to explore the park on five private game drives over the following three days. Today we enjoy two game drives, one in the early morning and one in the late afternoon as we look to spot the park's abundant wildlife and take in Kanha's beautiful vistas.

dayInfo.title: Another full day in Kanha National Park, with morning and afternoon game drives
dayInfo.description: : We have another day in Kanha National Park, with morning and afternoon game drives in our private 4WD jeeps alongside a naturalist. Morning game drives can be especially beautiful as we are out in the park just as the sun rises. But during the winter months these drives can be especially cold, so be sure to prepare with extra layers.

dayInfo.title: Morning game drive in Kanha NP, then drive to Jabalpur to catch the overnight train to Delhi
dayInfo.description: : We enjoy one final game drive in Kanha National Park this morning before we leave the boundaries of the park and drive to Jabalpur, a journey of approximately four to five hours including stops. From Jabalpur, we board our overnight train which will take us back to Delhi. Indian sleeper trains are a fantastic experience and a great way to meet people as we travel. We make our bookings in second-class air-conditioned sleepers, which have four beds in each compartment and all bedding provided. Whilst we try to ensure the group is all together, due to overwhelming demand and the system for booking train tickets in India, it may not always be possible to have everyone in the same carriage and some reservations may be in third-class air-conditioned. In such cases, our tour leaders will help everyone to find their seats and ensure you get the most out of your journey. For overnight trains, each berth is separated by curtains and has 4/6 bunk beds. Bedding (sheet, blanket and pillow) is provided but you may wish to bring your own sleeping bag liner for added comfort.

dayInfo.title: Free morning in Delhi, then explore the narrow lanes of Old Delhi on foot and by cycle rickshaw
dayInfo.description: : This morning has been left free to rest and freshen up before we go out and explore the temples and bazaars of Old Delhi. This afternoon we walk around the narrow, packed lanes of this fascinating part of the city, culminating with a jamboree of sounds at Chandni Chowk Bazaar. A short cycle rickshaw ride then takes us to the (outside of) Jama Masjid mosque, a sublime example of Mughal architecture built by emperor Shah Jahan and a bit of an oasis amid the city. Whilst in Old Delhi we will get to try some of the capital's street food treats straight from the stall sellers including aloo chaat (fried potato and spice mix) or paneer tikka (cottage cheese marinated in spices) along with freshly cooked breads such as parathas and rotis.

dayInfo.title: Tour ends in Delhi
dayInfo.description: : The trip ends after breakfast at our hotel in Delhi. There are no activities planned today, so you are free to depart from Delhi at any time. If your flight is departing later in the day, luggage storage facilities are available at our hotel. If you would like to receive a complimentary airport transfer today, you need to depart from New Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport (airport code DEL), which is around 45 minutes from the hotel.

dayInfo.description: Khajuraho / Bandhavgarh National Park - On arrival at the Khajuraho airport, you will be met by your guide and immediately depart for Bandhavgarh National Park (5-6 hours) in your private AC vehicle. When you arrive at your lodge in the border of Bandhavgarh you will check in and have the rest of the afternoon to rest before heading into the park tomorrow. (D)

Bandhavgarh National Park / Khajuraho - Today will be your last safari into Bandhavgarh this morning. Then after the morning safari you will leave the lodge and travel back to Khajuraho. Khajuraho is an ancient city and is well known for its magnificent temples, which were built between 950 and 1050 A.D. Khajuraho derives its name from the Khajur tree (the date palm tree), which can be found in abundance in the area. The divine sculptures in these temples are a tribute to Life itself, embodying everything that is sublime and spontaneous about it. The murals depict the life and times of the Chandelas, and celebrate the erotic state of being. They not only testify to the mastery of the craftsman, but also to the extraordinary breadth of vision of the Chandela Rajputs under whose reign, these temples were constructed. If we have time we will explore some of these temples after checking into our accommodation for your final night in central India. (B)
Home - This morning you will be collected at the hotel and taken to Khajuraho airport in time to catch your flight back to Delhi and therefore your onward flight home. (B)

They have survived over 4,500 years and are so detailed that they look like they were finished just yesterday. You can also have a guided tour of Old Delhi and the various temples, palaces and scared places here if you wish and can arrange your arrival flight into Delhi for the morning. This can be added on easily and for more information you can ask us.

We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

This tour is recommended for February - May as this is the dry season and the chances of seeing tigers is much higher in the dry season. However the temperatures from April onward can be very hot and humid. You can visit this park and enjoy the itinerary between October – June. The park is closed during the monsoon season.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• Our local Indian guides around Bandhavgarh have a good relationship with the park officials and because of this we get a heads up when animals are sighted and this can guide us in where to focus and thus increasing our chances of seeing our targeted species.
• We have an expert cultural guide who can interpret the intricate and numerous designs on the carvings of the Khajuraho temples.
• Visit the park morning and afternoon in your own private jeep for your group only.
• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and tiger safaris of India a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout India so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the tigers, leopards, sloth bears, dhole and many more species. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of India at other times of year and focusing on other species such as brown and snow leopards, Indian one-horned rhinos, Western Ghats endemics, elephants, primates, Asiatic lions and many species throughout this incredible country. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour is completely focused on one national park and tiger reserve, Bandhavgarh. It is located in Madhya Pradesh. We will fly in and out of Delhi and then travel onto Bhopal before reaching the park in the Indian wilderness. We also visit the cultural capital of Khajuraho on our way to Bandhavgarh.

Fitness Level:

The vast majority of wildlife watching is all done from a vehicle. So no physical fitness for hiking or anything like that is needed. This is a very easy trip to undertake.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 12 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Delhi - On arrival at the Delhi international airport, you will be met by your local guide/driver. From the airport you will be taken to your hotel for the night. Delhi, was once the capital of kingdoms and empires and is now a sprawling metropolis with a fascinating blend of the past and the present. It is a perfect introduction to the composite culture of an ancient land. Depending on the time of arrival we will spend some time exploring the city. (no meals included).

Khajuraho - After breakfast at the hotel in Delhi you will travel to the airport and take a short flight (2.20 hrs) to Khajuraho. On arrival in Khajuraho, you will meet a new local guide/driver, who will transfer you to the accommodation. Khajuraho is well known for its magnificent temples, which were built between 950 and 1050 A.D. The city derives its name from the Khajur tree (the date palm tree), which can be found in abundance in the area; and has become famous due to the divine sculptures in these temples which are a tribute to Life itself, embodying everything that is sublime and spontaneous about it. The murals depict the life and times of the Chandelas, and celebrate the erotic state of being. They not only testify to the mastery of the craftsman, but also to the extraordinary breadth of vision of the Chandela Rajputs under whose reign, these temples were constructed. After lunch you will be taken to the Eastern & Western groups of Temples for a guided tour. A highlight here is Kandariya Mahadeo, which is the largest and most typical Khajuraho temple. Dedicated to Lord Shiva, it soars 31 m high and makes a brilliant picture. (breakfast is the only meal included).

Bandhavgarh National Park - After breakfast in the Khajuraho hotel you will be collected and transfered in a private air conditioned vehicle to Bandhavgarh National Park (5-6 hours). Bandhavgarh National Park is set among the Vindhya Hills in Madhya Pradesh (a central Indian state). It is 168sq miles and is a mixture of bamboo, grassland, and a complex of deciduous forests. The dominant forest type is sal. The whole area is renowned for its bird life and there are at least 150 species of birds in the park, along with a wealth of mammals such as tigers, sloth bear, langur monkeys, wild boar, mongoose, 3 kinds of deer – chital, sambar and Indian muntjac, to name a few. In fact Bandhavgarh National Park has the highest density of tigers in the world. Once we arrive at Bandhavgarh we will check into our accommodation and in the afternoon you will have your first afternoon jungle safari by 4×4 open jeep accompanied by resident naturalist and forest park guide. With these companions you should have no problem in finding all the animals that are out and about. After the sun sets we return to the lodge and have evening tea. Dinner will be eat our evening meal here and get some sleep before an early start tomorrow. (breakfast and dinner included)

Delhi - After your breakfast you will depart from the park and start your journey back to Delhi. The drive to either Khajuraho or Jabalpur airport is around (4-5 hours) in our private air conditioned vehicle in time to catch our flight to Delhi. Once we arrive back in Delhi we will be met by our guide in Delhi and transferred to the hotel and the rest of the day will be free. (Breakfast only included today).
Home - Today you will be collected from your hotel and transferred to Delhi international airport in time to catch your flight home.

tourName: India tour, palaces and leopards
generalInfo:
Highlights : Palaces-Taj & Leopards

Visit National Capital New Delhi
Visit City of Lakes Udaipur
Visit Jawai for Bera leopards

An existing exploratory tour of desert realms and amazing edifices. Admire the ancient architectural masterpieces and discover the glory of India.

A wild safari in leopard country is the focus of this tour. Trail around every corner awaits you in this magical desert landscape the home of wild leopards. Join us for the memorable journey.

dayInfo.description: Arrive Delhi. Our representative will be waiting for you. He will take you to your hotel for check in. After trip discussion & fine dinner a sound sleep awaits. An exciting safari is waiting for you and an amazing Royal experience at Maharajah Lodge. Sleep Well!

Local sightseeing of Delhi: The Capital City can be breathtaking and it is in spite of the tremendous chaos. Hidden in between the modern metropolis is ancient jewels of architecture that astounds one and all. Red Fort, Humayun’s Tomb, Purana Qila, Qutub Minar and more. Choose your pick.

After Breakfast we take a direct flight to Udaipur. Assistance upon arrival later transfer to Hotel. Udaipur City in Rajasthan built by a legendary Maharajah Udai Singh extols his virtue as a valiant king and a magnificent architect of palaces and temples. After arrival we will visit Udaipur Palace and the Perfumed Garden or Saheliyon KI Badi. A stay at the heritage hotel resplendent in past glory is another

Udaipur offers romantic escapades like none. Mesmerizing Palaces and Forts, serene lakes, resplendent mansions or has and more. In this scenic locale amidst colourful people exploring the venues make an amazing holiday. Till time immemorial the visit will keep appearing in the memory lane. So gear up for the best in India.

Drive to Bera: The drive is one hundred forty km long but worth every penny. The unique, exotic hamlets and desert scapes are a treat to the travellers' eyes. Upon reaching beta we will explore the leopard country on open jeep. And we are sure to meet the big cats of the desert. The stay at Bear Safari Lodge is extremely comforting in a grand suite with exquisite decor and enchanting ambience. The enticing aroma of the cuisine does just that for your palate. We will stay overnight here. Wind and Dine and revel under starry night with inebriating cocktails and food.

Morning & Evening safaris. In the company of an acclaimed naturalist and leopard expert Shtrunjay Pratap the big cat experience is much enhanced. He managed to stop a mining debacle set to ravage this fragile ecosystem. His knowledge and expertise makes it worthy to be in his company. You will be able to see many leopards and learn all about them. This is an exploration journey worth its salt. So do not delay, book your tour now.
Drive to Udaipur to board flight to Delhi. Overnight stay at New Delhi.
Transfer to international airport

tourName: India wildlife and culture tour, Rajasthan
placesVisited: Delhi, Agra, Taj Mahal, Fatehpur Sikri, Bharatpur, Keoladao National Park, Jodhpur, Kumbhalgarh Wildlife Sanctuary, Aravali mountain range, Ellora, Mumbai
generalInfo:
Spend 18 days discovering the wildlife and culture of India on this remarkable tailor made tour that takes travellers into the sanctuaries and national parks of Rajasthan where jungles and mountains form an indelible backdrop for a Jeep safari.

From the importance that animals play within India’s cultural heritage to the thrill of tracking footprints in the jungle, this wildlife and culture tour of Rajasthan will leave travellers in no uncertain terms as to the relevance of the natural world and the part it plays in everything India holds dear.

With numerous national parks and hundreds of wildlife sanctuaries, this 18 day tailor made tour really lifts the lid on the wild side of Rajasthan with overnight campsites in the jungle and visits to ancient temples, such as Jain Temple, providing a unique glimpse at India’s natural and cultural heritage.

With a huge range of influences, including Hindi, Islamic and European, a tour of Rajasthan leads you from Delhi to Mumbai via Kumbhalgarh wildlife sanctuary for a series of classic and lesser-known sites to help you thread together the region’s natural and cultural history on a tour to truly savour.

dayInfo.description: Day 1 Arrive early morning at Delhi airport. On arrival you will be met by our tour manager, who will accompany you on this tour you will stay in boutique hotel. Breakfast and lunch at the hotel. Rest and relax at your hotel in the late afternoon. If you would like to go out in the evening for dinner or a short tour that would be fine. If you prefer to stay at hotel to relax as well as have dinner there that is also fine. DAY 2 Breakfast followed by a tour of Humuyuns Tomb and the Qutab Minar complex. Besides the famous tower the complex also has the finest metallurgy pillar made in the ancient world, created by the Guptas. After the Qutab Minar lunch followed by a tour of the Delhi Red Fort and Jama Masjid followed by exploring the old Delhi bazaar. In the evening dinner at Kareems, the 5th generation Mughal restaurant, followed by returning to hotel for night stay. DAY 3 Early morning transfer to the New Delhi railway station to board your Executive Class 1st AC train to Agra that departs at 6 am where breakfast will be served on board. Arrive in Agra just after 8 am proceed to your stay in hotel situated near west gate of Tajmahal,.
