Arrive at the hotel for relaxing and lunch until the early afternoon where you will depart on your tour of the Agra Red Fort. The Agra Red Fort has wonderful architecture. Return to hotel in the evening for dinner and night stay. DAY 4 Early light Breakfast followed by sunrise at the Taj Mahal for a 2-3 hour tour of the Taj Mahal and the surrounding buildings, museum and gardens. you will appreciate the incredible and detail petra dura (inlay work) craftsmanship is every ware on Tajmahal. In the early afternoon lunch in the Taj Mahal area followed by a tour of the Itmad-ud-Daula (the first marble tomb to be made in India as well as being the resting place of Noor Jehan’s father). Return to The hotel for dinner and night stay.

Day 5 Breakfast following leaving by road to Bharatpur (1 hour) via Fatehpur Sikri. Fatehpur Sikri is the magnificent 16th Century Mughal capital city (40 minutes from Bharatpur). There is both the royal palace complex as well as the mosque complex that also has the wonderful Buland Darwaza which is the main gate into the city as well as the tallest gate in the world. The mausoleum of Salim Chisti which has some of the finest carved latticed marble screens in India is inside the main square. Proceed to Bharatpur in the late afternoon. Your accommodation here is a small lodge dedicated to wildlife and birding at the edge of the Keoladao National Park. The Keoladao National Park is also a World Heritage site. The National Park has forest, a bit of savannah and much wetlands where over 400 different resident and migratory birds are present. It is a special place and for a few years it was of concern as many species were not present as they were for many years until 2013 when many returned bringing this wetland jungle back to its former glory. Besides the many birds other commonly seen species include Chital (spotted deer), wild boar, and jungle cats. The fishing cat is now rarely seen outside of Eastern India where it is now present only in a few places. Keoladao National Park has a small population which is the only known fishing cat population in western India. Arrive at your accommodation for relaxing, dinner and night stay. Day 6 6 am breakfast followed by leaving by bicycle rickshaw into the Keoladao National Park for a 3 hour wildlife safari with your guide as well as with a local naturalist. This wildlife safari will be partly by bicycle rickshaw, walking and row boats. Return to lodge for lunch and relaxing before your mid afternoon return to the jungle for a further 2 hour wildlife safari. Return to lodge for dinner and night stay. Day 7 Early morning Breakfast followed by leaving by road to Ranthanbore (3 hours). Ranthanbore National Park is a beautiful jungle where the last remaining indigenous population of tiger still exists in Rajasthan. Your stay in erstwhile hunting lodge (converted into the hotel) of the Royal family of Jaipur. The hunting lodge sets on a rocky outcrop surrounded by indigenous forest that borders the National Park with many species of animals including herds of Spotted Dear (Chital), and the occasional leopard that roam here. After arrival lunch followed by your first tiger wildlife safari in the mid afternoon to late afternoon by jeep in the jungle (2 hours). Return to hotel in the late evening for dinner and night stay. Day 8 Early morning breakfast followed by your second tiger wildlife safari in the jungle (2 to 2 and half hours). Return for brunch at hotel followed by leaving by road to 16 century Fort palace. Lunch at Fort Palace (3 and half hour drives). The Fort Palace is in a village setting and is the only royal palace in India where guests can stay inside the authentic 16th Century Princess Room. This is unchanged from this period except for the addition of electricity and the bathroom. The Princess room is large and lovely. The architecture of the Fort is also very fine. Arrive in evening for relaxing, exploring the fort palace followed by dinner and night stay in the Princess room.

DAY 9 Your Another one night stay in Fort (3 hours drive) it was constructed in early 1611 A.D. for Maharajah Gopal Das Ji, who was granted ‘Jagirs’ (fiefdoms) of Area of nearby villages of the Fort ,his great achievement in war against the Mughals, in honour of his service to the Maharaja of Jodhpur. DAY 10 Breakfast followed by road to Jodhpur (1 and half hour drive). After arrive at Jodhpur, the tour of the15th-18th centaury Jodhpur Mehrangarh (Mejestic) Fort was laid by Rao Jodha, the Fort is named after Brahmin (particular cast) Mehran. The fort had more accommodation for women than for men as two thirds of the palace is taken up by the zenana (for ladies). Walls of Mehrangarh are 125 ft high and made of red sand stone. In the early afternoon lunch in the finest restaurant of this region followed by trying some of the famous Jodhpur desserts. Before return to Manor home in the evening for a display of the finest South Asian art mediums produced by the last remaining erstwhile royal appointed master artisans will be shown to you with explanations on history and processes. Drinks followed by a traditional dinner and a concert of erstwhile Jodhpur royal appointed musicians at Manor home. Day 11 Breakfast followed by leaving by road to the Jagnath Wildlife Safari (Sanctuary 2 and a half hours) Arrival at the Jagnath Wildlife Sanctuary in the early afternoon. The Jagnath Wildlife Sanctuary is India’s only family owned and operated wildlife sanctuary. It is the last semi-arid eco system left in India intact and an abundance of rare and endangered species are present. We offer two wildlife safaris per day; the first would be at night an hour after dark by jeep. This is for 3 hours for you to view the nocturnal species of the sanctuary. These include the endangered Asian Steppe Wildcat (the sanctuary has the highest number of this rare cat of any protected area), Jungle Cat, Leopard, The Great Eurasian Eagle Owl, Desert Hare, the endangered Desert Fox, Indian Porcupine, and at risk Striped Hyena. Following your night safari drinks and dinner by a sustainable campfire at our permanent campsite. You will stay in a private cottage with attached bath. The sanctuary has no villages inside and the atmosphere quite relaxing and beautiful with savannah grasslands, foothills and Granite Mountains covered in deciduous forests surrounding the permanent safari campsite. Dinner after your night safari followed by night stay in your private bungalow in the safari campsite. DAY 12 Early morning breakfast followed by your second safari is in the morning by foot for three hours in the savannah and foothills to view herds of Gazelle, Blue-Bull Antelope (Asia’s largest Antelope), Zird (similar to a Gerbil but more timid), troops of Hanuman Langoor and up to 200 different bird species including the Tawny Eagle, Imperial Eagle, Eurasian Vulture, and the critically endangered Long-Billed Vulture. Return to the campsite. After early lunch visit the Shepherds village to experience local countryside life, return to campsite for your second night safari by jeep. Drinks followed by the dinner and night stay in your privet bungalow.

Day 13 Breakfast followed by departing by road (3 hours) to Sena Leopard conservation zone situated at the border of Kumbhalgarh wildlife Sanctuary. This area is near the village of Sena and the highest chance to see great sightings of Leopard in the wild in India is here. Almost every wildlife safari in the evening Leopard is present. Arrival for lunch at your privet cottage (With en suite bath) for guests in the village area. A late afternoon wildlife safari by jeep to first a small wetland area in the foothills of Aravali mountain range, where local and migratory birds are present along with muggermuch (mugger crocodile) followed by 2 hours Leopard safari where you will see Leopard up close, other species that are possible to see include Rufous-tailed Hare and jackal. Late evening barbeque dinner followed by night stay. Day 14 Breakfast followed by an early morning safari to an area that has many muggermuch crocodile and birding possibilities. Lunch at our campsite followed by a relaxing early afternoon before your second evening wildlife safari for Leopard. Late evening dinner and night stay. Day 15 Breakfast followed by leaving by road to Udaipur (via Ranikpur) 4 and half hours. Arrive at Ranikpur for lunch followed by exploring the 15th Century Jain Temple complexes for a couple of hours after lunch. There are also a few older temples that are Hindu that are worthwhile to see as well. Those who have interests in culture, history, architecture and wildlife this would be the perfect place for them to experience. We are close friends with Princess who would be your hostess at her family’s 16th Century Fort. She opened part of the palace for guests to stay in six years ago. It is also the gateway to one of the least well known but very special jungles of India, the Sita Mata. Arrive at Fort in the early evening for relaxing and exploring the palace. If you wish the palace has fine Marwari Horses nearby at their stables and 60 acres for riding. Princess has also just put in a lovely swimming pool if you like to swim. Dinner at the Fort. Day 16 Breakfast followed by transfer to Udaipur airport for domestic flight to Aurangabad for Ajanta and Ellora. After arrival check in your Boutique hotel. Rest and relaxing in hotel. Dinner and night stay in hotel.

DAY 17 Morning breakfast followed the tour of Ellora. The cave temples and monasteries at Ellora, excavated out of the vertical face of an escarpment, are 26 km north of Aurangabad. Extending in a linear arrangement, the 34 caves contain Buddhist Chaityas or halls of worship, and Viharas, or monasteries, Hindu and Jain temples. Spanning a period of about 600 years between the 5th and 11th century AD, the earliest excavation here is of the Dhumar Lena (Cave 29).The most imposing excavation is, without doubt, that of the magnificent Kailasa Temple (Cave 16) which is the largest monolithic structure in the world. Interestingly, Ellora, unlike the site of Ajanta, was never 'rediscovered'. Known as Verul in ancient times, it has continuously attracted pilgrims through the centuries to the present. Dinner at local restaurants and catch the train at 21:35 pm for Mumbai arrived at 5:40 am and transfer to hotel in colaba area. DAY 18 after breakfast the day is at your leisure, you can explore the streets of Colaba and magnificent view of Gate way of India from Tajmahal Palace hotel. We will arrange your airport departure according to your return flight schedule.

tourName: India wildlife tour, Ranthambore and Chambal River
generalInfo:
India is a wealth of wonderful wildlife, historical and cultural attractions. There is an never ending variety of historical sites to visit and wilderness areas to observe animals and this tour provides you with a great overview of Indian culture and wildlife.

Introduction:
This tour is perfect for people visiting India for the first time or seasoned travellers to the Subcontinent. This tour will showcase two of the best reasons to travel to India as well as visiting probably the last refuge for two of the worlds most unusual and endangered species. Combining sightseeing of historical sites in Old Delhi, and marvelling at the magnificent Taj Mahal, with tiger safaris in the stunning and culturally important Ranthambore National Park and river safaris looking for gharial and Gangetic river dolphins; this is the perfect overall wildlife holiday of India.

Ranthambore is probably the most iconic of all Indian tiger reserves and we visit here to look for tigers. The most iconic and famous wildlife resident of India is the tiger and many of the tigers that live in Ranthambore are very well known. They are regularly filmed for various documentaries and most of known by name. It is a great way to further understand the tiger and it's role in modern India.

Along with the tigers we will see in Ranthambore and the cultural excursions taken to Old Delhi and Agra which will include sites such as Taj Mahal, Red Fort and Agra Fort; this tour also visits the Chambal River Sanctuary. This is one of the most important sanctuaries in the world for 2 of the world's most endangered large animals, the large fish-eating crocodilian, gharial, and the Gangetic river dolphin. These two species are commonly seen here and coupled with the tiger provide chances to see some of the world's most endangered and wonderful species.

We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of Indian wildlife watching safari holidays. These tours range from the dry desert regions of Gujarat in search of striped hyena and Asiatic lions to the icy peaks of the Himalayas on the quest for snow leopards. But we also have a range of specific birding and bird watching tours, this being one of them.

This tour is a specialist wildlife and cultural tour of north-west India. There are many species of mammals, birds and reptiles that can be found in Ranthambore and Chambal. The different ecosystems of sal forest, bamboo groves and meadows coupled with the river and wetlands of the Chambal Sanctuary are home to a great diversity of life of all kinds. But of course no trip to India is complete without visiting religious and culturally important iconic sites such as the Taj Mahal.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in cities and towns. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through India and particularly tiger safaris. Your naturalist escort is an expert in ornithology and their conservation and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. We will also employ a specific cultural guide for all sightseeing of temples and monuments.

The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, river safaris, spotlighting, guided walks, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

This tour is recommended for February - May as this is the dry season and the chances of seeing tigers is much higher in the dry season. However the temperatures from April onward can be very hot and humid. You can visit this park and enjoy the itinerary between October – June. The park is closed during the monsoon season.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• Our local Indian guides have a good relationship with the park and reserve officials and because of this we get a heads up when animals are sighted and this can guide us in where to focus and thus increasing our chances of seeing our targeted species.
• Visit the parks and reserves morning and afternoon in your own private vehicle for your group only.
• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and bird watching holidays of India a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout India so that we can try and find and observe birds. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of India at other times of year and focusing on other species such many mammals like tigers, snow leopards, elephants, rhinos and many species throughout this incredible country. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour is focused on two wildlife watching locations in the northern part of India, the great national park of Ranthambore as well as the Chambal River Sanctuary and then the iconic cities of Delhi and Agra.

Fitness Level:

The vast majority of wildlife watching is all done from a vehicle. So no physical fitness for hiking or anything like that is needed. This is a very easy trip to undertake.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Delhi - Arrival On arrival at the airport you will meet your local guide and be transferred to your hotel. If your flight arrives in the morning you can enjoy sightseeing of Old Delhi. This part of town boasts some of the best preserved monuments dating back to the powerful Mughal empire such as Red Fort, Humayun Tomb and the Qutub Minar and all of this before your first evening meal in India on a roof top restaurant amid the flying foxes leaving to forage in the night sky. (no meals included today).

Ranthambore National Park - Travelling After breakfast this morning you will be transferred south to Ranthambore National Park (5- hours). You will arrive at your lodge for the next 3 nights and the rest of the is at your leisure. (breakfast and dinner included today).

Agra - Travelling & Sightseeing This morning after a later breakfast than the last couple of days you will be transferred to the wonderful city of Agra (~4 hours) in your private vehicle. Once here you will be taken to your hotel. Then in the afternoon you will have a guided tour of one of the wonders of the world, the majestic Taj Mahal. This marvel of human engineering took 20,000 men 22 years to complete for the emperor Shah Jahan as a tomb for his beloved wife. But it is not just the beautiful architecture and manicured gardens that hold the attention in the Taj Mahal grounds, there are numerous bird species to be found here too. From Egyptian vultures and black kites that nest on the high turrets and minarets of the buildings to many babblers, warblers, grey hornbills and the very approachable common tailorbird that can be found in the gardens. After spending a couple of hours here you will come back to the hotel. (breakfast only included today).

Chambal River Sanctuary - Travelling & Wildlife Watching This morning you will be transferred in your private vehicle to the wonderful Chambal River Sanctuary (~2 hours). Before exploring this river sanctuary you will be taken to the lodge. This is a huge sanctuary which protects one of the largest and most biologically valuable rivers in India, covering a 400km stretch of the river and protecting around 1.6 km on either side of the river the sanctuary is 1235km sq. The sanctuary was initially set up for the gharial, these huge fish-eating crocodile can grow to 7m long and is the most critically endangered species in the Indian subcontinent. There may be as few as 250 breeding individuals in the world and the vast majority live along the Chambal river. But as well as providing protection for this magnificent and ancient animal the sanctuary now has over 330 bird species recorded as well as other mammals, reptiles and amphibians that now rely on this protected stretch of water. After settling into the accommodation and lunch you will be taken on a river safari here to welcome you to the birdlife. You should encounter small pratincoles, numerous duck species, black-winged stilts, common & spotted redshanks, ospreys, bar-headed geese and up to 100 other water birds. You may also see both gharial and the other crocodile species here the mugger crocodile as well as up to 8 species of freshwater turtles (all of which are endangered), the unsual and endangered Gangetic river dolphin and possible a family of foraging or playing smooth-coated otters. When you arrive back to the lodge you are free to stroll the gardens as the sunsets and listen to the many Indian flying foxes that roost and feed in the trees around the lodge, before your evening meal. (all meals included today).

Chambal River Sanctuary Over the next two days you will further explore the various ecosystems of the Chambal River sanctuary, there are a variety of activities that can be provided by the lodge and exactly what you want to do and the order of the activities will vary. But we recommend the following itinerary for your stay at this eco-lodge; after breakfast on the first full day here we suggest taking a jeep safari to the plains that surround areas of the Chambal river, you will travel to some isolated ravines in the Chambal sanctuary to try and find one of the most beautiful animals in India, the stunning blackbuck antelope. There is a small population here protected in the sanctuary, whilst the blackbuck was once widespread throughout the Gangetic plains, hunting and habitat destruction all but wiped the antelope out. This used to be the favoured prey of the Indian cheetah and there are ongoing talks about reintroducing the cheetah to the Gangetic plains and that would be a wonderful sight. Whilst spending the afternoon here you are likely to see some species of birds that have spend their time on the open grasslands that the blackbuck favour such as coursers, harriers and possibly falcons. Then after coming back to the lodge and having lunch you would be taken the short distance to the ancient Bateshwar Temple complex. These Hindu temples are built on the banks of the Yamuna river and consist of over 100 temples dedicated to Lord Shiva. The ravines surrounding the temples and river are home to a number of Naga sadhus (snake worshiping ascetics) who have carved out little caves and temples within the mud walls. These temples are a very nice way to see how the Hindu people around here still use these ancient temples in ways that have not changes for hundreds, possibly thousands of years. The next day we suggest participating in a camel ride safari through some of the ravines that fork off from the Chambal River, here you are likely to see a different range of birdlife including plain martins, wire-tailed swallows, jungle babblers, steppe eagles, sand lark, wood sandpipers and large grey babblers. Travelling on camel back is a wonderful experience and a great way of exploring the ravines and river bank whilst on the way to another ancient building. This is Ater fort and it is a magnificent site perched on the cliff side. It is also home to many species of raptors and other bird species; once a valued stronghold and at the forefront of numerous battles between the Rajputs, the Mughals and the Marathas, the crumbling ruins bring alive the romantic glory of a bygone age but it is the breathtaking views out over the Chambal valley that are truly spectacular. From here a scan of the skies can produce many more species and hopefully some of the critically endangered vultures. Then after lunch you will have a guided walk along a new section of the Chambal river bank. By walking the riverbanks with the local guide from the lodge you will be in good hands when it comes to spotting some of the harder to see mammals birds and reptiles such as golden jackals, black-naped hares, Burmese spot-bellied duck, Temmincks stint, Pallas gull, Indian skimmer and some of the 9 species of freshwater turtles here. Whilst spending time around the lodge you are free to explore the vibrant and diverse gardens. In the grounds of the lodge the abundant flowers attract many sunbirds and the fruiting trees are home to commersmith and brown-headed barbets, many babblers, hornbills, koels, treepies as well as being the day roosts for flying foxes and owls. Also whilst here, if you are not too tired we recommend a guided evening walk around the expansive grounds of the lodge; these walks often find Indian palm civets, jungle cats, Indian foxes, black-naped hares, hedgehogs and possibly the very elusive striped hyena. Of course the skies will be full of flying foxes, owls and nightjars as well. (all of your meals included).

Delhi - Travelling Today you will be transferred back to the capital city of Delhi (4-5 hours) after breakfast in your own private vehicle. After arriving at your hotel you will have the rest of the afternoon free to relax and maybe purchase some souvenirs, head over to the Yamuna river for some more birding or visit some more of the many sights here. (breakfast only included).
Home This morning after breakfast we will arrange for transfers to Delhi International Airport so you can catch your return flight home. (breakfast only)

tourName: Kerala and tigers tour in India
generalInfo:
This magical 11-day tour of India provides you with an unbeatable mix of landscapes and experiences. From the Dutch forts of Cochin to the high-altitude tea estate of Kolukkumulai, you are sure to experience the wonders India has to offer.

Starting in Cochin, you will be treated to wonderful Dutch-inspired hotel, an elegant base from which to explore the city and with its own superb dining experience not to be missed. Once you have found your feet, it's off into the mountains where you will discover the pristine air of a high-altitude tea plantation. Check into the original staff quarters, roll up your sleeves and get ready to learn about top-quality tea production. Enjoy a breath-taking hike up India's second highest peak (don't worry - we'll send you with a picnic) and soak up the fresh air, staggering views and tranquillity of the mountains.

From mountains to rivers - your next stop takes you to the twisting waterways of Kerala. Explore this lush region and its vast network of channels from the comfort of an original wooden houseboat.

Head back to civilisation with a trip to India's most famous city - Delhi. Spend some time soaking up the bustle before heading back into the wilderness to Bandhavgarh National Park. Three days of thrilling game drives should reward with sightings of birdlife, wild boar, cheetas and bison, but most importantly India's highest density of tigers.

Your luxurious park lodge provides the perfect base with a tranquil outdoor swimming pool and beautiful sympathetically built eco-cottages which blend into the forest background.

At the end of your stay you will return briefly to Delhi before making your return flight armed with promises of returning.

Internal travel arrangements are included, along with a guide and private chauffeur driven car for transfers. Internal Flights are included however international flights are excluded in the price but can be quoted for separately and any additional activities can be added or tweaked to your liking. Meals are as specified in the itinerary.

dayInfo.description: Your chauffeur will collect you from Cochin airport and transfer you to your hotel in a private car. Once you have checked in, enjoy a half day tour of this beautiful city. Believed to be the oldest European settlement in India, there are a number of fascinating architectural sights plus historic Fort Cochin to enjoy before returning to your luxurious hotel to unwind.

Leave the city and head into the countryside in a jeep as you travel a winding dirt track up to the highest tea plantation in the world. Learn about the history of tea making and its modern incarnation and how the high altitude produces the finest quality tea. You'll stay in the well-equipped guest room in the heart of the estate. (B, L, D)
Enjoy a full day surrounded by mountains as you hike on a full day trek up the second highest peak in the Western Ghats. A guide and picnic lunch are provided. (B, L, D)
Time to try your hand at tea-making as you roll up your sleeves and have a go at creating your own blend. (B, L, D)

Today you will take to the water to board a houseboat in Alleppey. From your vantage point on deck, explore the lagoons, lakes, canals and estuaries which make up the 900km of backwater of Kerala. Experience the local tradition of coir rope making and fishing and discover the importance of these canals for washing, transport and food. Spend the night on board your boat and let the peaceful sounds of water lull you to sleep. (B, L, D)
Enjoy a full day exploring the waterways before returning to dry land late afternoon and heading onto the bustling city of Delhi. (B)

Hop on a plane to visit Bandhavgargh National Park, home to the highest density of tigers in India. For the next three days you will enjoy a variety of game drives across the broken hilly terrain and grassy swamps spotting not just tiger, but the incredible variety of wildlife and bird species which live in this beautiful National Park. (B, L, D)
Return to Delhi and spend the day exploring the city. Speak to us about adding in a guided tour. (B)
You will be collected from your hotel and driven to the airport for your return flight. (B)

tourName: Ladakh wildlife holiday, India
generalInfo:
Few places look as barren and inhospitable than the Trans-Himalayan highlands. Empty, rolling plains mostly made up of rock and scree as well as a few hardy grass species and stunted trees and bushes; all dominated by inaccessible steep rocky mountains and outcrops.

All of this do not seem like the best place to find wildlife. But this ecosystem is teeming with animals, from the ghost-like snow leopard and Eurasian lynx to herd dwelling Tibetan wild asses (kiang), argali, Asiatic ibex and Ladakhi urail there is a raft a life here waiting to be seen.

This tour is a specialist tour where some of the most elusive and specially adapted species of mammals and birds are searched for. So if you wish to be one of the few wildlife watchers to explore the vastness of India's Himalayas and possibly see some of the rarest species in the world then this tour is for you.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching tours and safari holidays all over the world, specialising in the Indian subcontinent and of course the wonderful and diverse country of India. Whilst most wildlife watchers who visit India spend time in the famous tiger reserves of the central plains or maybe the forests and grasslands of the north east of India and the Western Ghats in the south. But these ecosystems and incredible wildlife are just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to the wildlife that India has to offer.

This tour explores some of the lesser known regions and takes you into the wildest and least inhabited parts of India’s north west Himalayas. All of this whilst escorted by our very own expert zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us)coupled with local guides. Of course there is one species in particular that dominates everyone’s thoughts and dreams when they think of the stunning Himalayas nowadays and that is the majestic snow leopard.

Whilst there are chances of seeing snow leopards here we take time to showcase the their ecosystem in full and try and find as many other animals that share the mountains with snow leopards. Most of this trip will involve driving to spotting and scanning locations as well as walking among the high altitude grasslands and rocky slopes looking for animals that make this inhospitable locations their home.

One of the reasons why our safaris of India are unique is that our background (as a company) is from a scientific and zoological standpoint and so have a great network of colleagues and contacts all over the world who are the people on the front line in search of the best new locations for wildlife watching in the wild. All of these reasons and many more make us experts in arranging and guiding safaris and are able to tailor a Indian safaris to any location to try to find them that you request. All you have to do is to get in touch with us and tell us your budget and your group size and where you would like to go on safari.
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of Indian wildlife watching safari holidays. These tours range from the dry desert regions of Gujarat in search of striped hyena and Asiatic lions to the icy peaks of the Himalayas on the quest for snow leopards. But we also have a range of specific birding and bird watching tours, this being one of them.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in cities and towns. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through India and particularly birding holidays. Your naturalist escort is an expert in ornithology and their conservation and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. We will also employ a specific cultural guide for all sightseeing of temples and monuments.

The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, trekking permits, spotlighting, guided walks, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

This tour is recommended for the northern hemisphere summer season. This is not the normal season people visit Ladakh for snow leopards, but they are seen throughout the year with good regularity. But the key factor here is that during the summer there are more roads and passes open to explore and the diversity of wildlife is much higher. Many of the herbivorous animals and migratory birds which leave to head to areas not covered with snow in winter are here in their numbers.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our bird watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• Our local Indian guides have a good relationship with the park and reserve officials and because of this we get a heads up when animals are sighted and this can guide us in where to focus and thus increasing our chances of seeing our targeted species.
• Visit the parks and reserves morning and afternoon in your own private vehicle for your group only.
• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and bird watching holidays of India a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout India so that we can try and find and observe birds. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of India at other times of year and focusing on other species such many mammals like tigers, snow leopards, elephants, rhinos and many species throughout this incredible country. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour visits a range of locations around Ladakh, your entry and exit point in Ladakh will be the city of Leh and when you arrive and depart from India you will travel through Delhi.

Fitness Level:

This tour is at high altitude and whilst it is not full hiking, there are no long days of trekking; there are some hikes at altutude included and so a level of fitness or experience of being at altitude is needed for full enjoyment of the trip.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Delhi - Arrival & Sightseeing On your arrival into Delhi you will be met by your local driver and guide and driven to hotel. If your flight arrived in the morning you will then later in the afternoon you will be taken to the Sultanpur National Park. This is a pleasant national park close to Delhi; whilst here it may be possible to see a jungle cat as well as several species of birds including sarus cranes, black-necked stork and dozens of species of waders and waterfowl and maybe some raptor species before returning to your hotel for the night. (no meals included today).

Leh - Travelling & Acclimitisation This morning after breakfast you will be taken to the domestic airport to catch the plane north to the state of Ladakh and the capital Leh (3,500m). Once you arrive in Leh you will be met by your new local guide who will take you to your hotel. You will spend the next two nights here to begin to acclimatise to the altitude. In the evening you will have your welcome to the Himalayas meal at your hotel where your guide will brief you on the rest of the trip. (breakfast and dinner included today).

Leh - Wildlife Watching (Acclimitisation) Today most of the morning will be kept free for further acclimatization with a walk up to Shanti Stupa located north of the main town and at an altitude of 4,267m. However this afternoon we will try and find some interesting Himalayan birds, there are very few mammals around Leh so until we get more remote we will see what the avian world has to offer. A short downhill walk in the Stok area should prove productive for species like red & yellow billed choughs, Eurasian tree sparrows, Himalyan chukars, common kestrels, citrine wagtails and white-capped water redstarts. We will also keep our eyes open for mammals such as woolly hares and Himalayan pikas. In the late afternoon we will return to the accommodation for your dinner. (breakfast and dinner included today).

Uley - Travelling & Wildlife Watching After breakfast you will be transferred to Uley village (~2 hours). The drive will bring us through the villages of Likir and Hemis Sukpachang and then eventually to the tiny village of Uley. The Snow Leopard Conservancy have reported snow leopard sightings in every month of the year here and the chances are pretty good for a sighting of the grey ghost. Over the next three full days we will have this elusive cat at the top of our list of animals to try and find. Started as soon as we have rested and grabbed some lunch. The village itself is made up of 4 or 5 houses and their families, the main livelihood being sheep, goat or yak farming and during our stay here your accommodation will be with these local people as they have opened their land to tourism and we will camp close to their houses and enjoy their hospitality. It is great to be welcomed into a small village such as this and hear of stories from people that live their lives in the presence of the ghost-like snow leopard. (all meals included)

Leh - Travelling This morning you will leave Uley and begin the journey back to Leh in our private vehicle (~2 hours). After a few days of camping and hiking through the mountains you will be thankful for a hot shower and after a rest you will be free to indulge is some shopping and check out the local restaurants in downtown Leh. (breakfast and dinner are the only meals included today)

Tso Kor - Travelling & Wildlife Watching Early this morning you will be taken to the check post at Karu and after a hot roadside breakfast you will continue onto Tso Kar via Lato and Rumtse – this is a spectacular drive. Lato is where the Indian plate collided with the Eurasian plate about 55 million years ago and you can see the impact of the collision here. The steep crevices and the rock faces in brilliant hues of pink, green, purple, red and ochre show what occurred in stunning colours. Here along the riversides you will be stopping to look for brown dipper, fire-fronted serins, Eurasian crag martin, Northern house martin, hill pigeon as well as fly bys from Himalayan griffons. There are chances of sighting mammals around here like the mountain weasel, stone marten, blue sheep and few other mammals. We will carry on towards Rumtse and look for golden eagle on a well known nest here, then wait and see if we can get to see the long tailed marmots, there will be birds like lammergeier, osprey, golden eagle, Himalayan griffon and of course possibilities of Himalayan snowcock, Tibetan partridge etc as we move towards Tso Kar. Along the way there are lots of birds species that can be seen including large flocks of horned larks, Tibetan snow finches, robin, brown and black-throated accentor, Tibetan lark, Brandt mountain finch etc near the Tso Kar area. Some of the speciality bird species here include the black-necked crane, great crested grebe, black-necked grebe, common tern, white-winged tern, Tibetan sandgrouse, nesting bar-headed geese and ruddy shelducks, saker falcon, upland buzzard and little owls. Also around here we will try are best to see some of the Himalayan mammal species such as Tibetan wild ass, woolly hare, silvery mountain vole, Tibetan argali, Tibetan wolf (however the chances of wolves depends on the movements of the Nomads as they follow them) and dhole. There is a small population of Eurasian lynx in the area surrounding this place however they are very hard to see here. So we will keep a look out for this with our local guide. After exploring the area for its mammals and birds we will head back to the accommodation, level camping; for your evening meal. (all of your meals are included today).

Tso Moriri - Wildlife Watching & Travelling Early this morning you can have a walk towards Starstapuk Tso, a fresh water lake nearby where we have camped the night before. Here you will check the edge of the lake carefully as Tibetan sandgrouse as they inhabit these areas. Mammals here include Tibetan argali, blue sheep and Tibetan gazelle, which we will scan the hillsides for. After breakfast we will drive to the Tso Moriri plains looking for red fox, Tibetan wolves, Himalayan marmot, Royles pika, Ladakh pika, woolly hare and Tibetan wild ass. Tso Moriri is the breeding ground of the bar headed geese and the ruddy shelduck, there are other birds like Humes short toed lark, Humes groundpecker, common raven, plain mountain finch, white rumped snowfinch and twite. On reaching Tso Moriri we will set up the hotel in time for your dinner. (all meals included today)

Tso Moriri - Wildlife Watching Today is kept as a spare day, either to spend around the Tso Kar area or can be the Tso Moriri area, this decision will be based on which location offers the best wildlife watching when we are there and what species we have already seen and which we hope to still see. There is also an area between Tso Moriri and Mahe which is Sumdo, Upper Sumdo, Chumathang as far as Yoye Tso. During the afternoon we will move to this area and set up the camp once again. By doing this we make the long drive back to Leh tomorrow shorter. (all meals included today).

Leh - Travelling This morning you will start early and drive back to Leh, the drive is through some very interesting habitats and we will make birding stops at different places. Once back at Leh this afternoon, we will check into the hotel and then you are free for some retail therapy at the local markets. Before your evening meal and last night in the Himalayas. (breakfast and dinner included today).

Delhi - Travelling This morning you will fly back to Delhi and after checking into the hotel with the rest of the afternoon will be kept free for you to relax or souvenir shop before your farewell meal in the evening. (breakfast is the only meal included today)
Home - Departure After breakfast you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included).

tourName: Leopard safari and culture, India
generalInfo:
Bera is well Known as a destination for leopard sightings in an open Jawai Dam at Bera is in the Pali District of the State of Rajasthan. The Pali district encloses Jawai Dam (Baand) which lies adjacent to a village called Bera. Together they constitute Jawai Bandh Community Reserve. In recent times the surroundings have become famous for leopard (panther) sightings in the open and their harmonious existence with villagers. River Jawai forms a habitable ecosystem for leopards and megafauna.
Udaipur situated in the State of Rajasthan Udaipur is a panoramic historical city. The city glorifies urbanity through its beautiful lakes, gardens, noble houses, and palaces. Historical temples are regulars for the pious. Udaipur extols ancient and modern with architectural excellence modern and ancient. The battlegrounds were the forts simply made for war and enclosure for embattled citizens.
The most amazing aspect of the structures besides the ancient architecture, is the amazing fine arts and embellished interiors. This is typical of Rajasthan but the palaces amidst the lakes are exceptional. Only a visit will reveal the secrets of Udaipur.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Delhi, our executive will be at the airport to welcome you later he will transfer you to the hotel. Day to relax overnight Hotel.

Post a sumptuous breakfast we are on the way for Delhi sightseeing. The historical places we will visit today are Qutub Minar, Jama Masjid Nation's largest Mosque, the oldest bazaar Chandni Chowk the spice market get one get all masalas available pan India. Here we will enjoy a Rickshaw Ride, then visit the elegant but imposing Red Fort, Raj Ghat-a memorial to Mahatma Gandhi, and the Humayun's tomb-Delhi's finest example of Mughal architecture. In New Delhi, we will pray at Bahai Lotus Temple and Swami Narayan Temple. Next, we visit The Parliament House, The President House, and India Gate. The rest of the day is free at your leisure. During our visit, Indian Cuisine on our palate is assured. Overnight at our Hotel.

Today post breakfast we take an early flight to Udaipur, arrive at Udaipur then drive straight to Bera Jawai, for the evening safari. We will be enjoying our stay at a popular heritage lodge at Bera, and enjoy the vegetarian food Marwar is famous for. The lodge is environmentally friendly and leaves fewer carbon footprints. The vegetarian is a delightful serving of several delicious recipes Marwar is famous for. You will relish each, and every dish, it will be an unforgettable experience.
Morning & evening safari. The safaris are organized on open jeeps with a naturalist guide who knows the area very well. We will also enjoy birding and the sights of other wild animals.
After breakfast drive to Udaipur, and check in at the hotel later we will do half-day sightseeing. We will visit local bazars of Udaipur, evening Light and sound show at City Palace.
After breakfast we will set out for Udaipur sight seeing a of lakes. On this day we will visit Lake Pichola, Jagmandir, City Palace, and Jagdish Temple. Boat ride at Lake Pichola.Overnight Udaipur.
After Breakfast we take a direct flight to Delhi. Overnight Delhi day to relax.
After breakfast transfer to International airport for your flight Back home

tourName: North India wildlife expedition tour
generalInfo: Embark on an unforgettable 12-day wildlife and nature safari across some of North India’s most pristine and diverse wilderness landscapes. Your journey begins in Delhi, where you can unwind after arrival before setting off for Rajaji National Park. Nestled in the Shivalik foothills, Rajaji offers thrilling encounters with elephants, leopards, and a rich variety of birdlife, explored over two days of morning and evening safaris while staying at the charming Rosette Farmstead. From there, travel to the iconic Corbett Tiger Reserve and settle into Jim’s Jungle Retreat. Enjoy safaris through the Jhirna, Dhela, and Bijrani zones—renowned for their high tiger and elephant populations, as well as opportunities to spot sloth bears and hornbills. After immersing yourself in Corbett’s scenic beauty, continue to the remote and wild Terai region, arriving at Dudhwa National Park. Over three days, explore both Dudhwa and Kishanpur Wildlife Sanctuary—lesser-visited parks that promise sightings of the rare one-horned rhinoceros, swamp deer, and an incredible variety of raptors and forest birds. Your base here is the cozy Tiger Lilly Lodge, offering comfort and hospitality in the heart of the jungle. Each park showcases its own unique ecosystem, from alluvial grasslands to dense sal forests, ensuring a diverse and rewarding wildlife experience. The itinerary concludes with a return to Delhi for a final night of relaxation before your onward journey. This expertly curated safari is ideal for nature lovers, photographers, and wildlife enthusiasts eager to explore India’s untamed beauty in comfort and style.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at Delhi Airport, you will be received and transferred to your hotel, Novotel Delhi. The rest of the day is at leisure, giving you time to relax or explore the surroundings at your own pace. Overnight stay at Novotel Delhi. Meal Plan: Bed & Breakfast

After breakfast, check out from Novotel Delhi, and begin your scenic 4-hour drive to Rajaji National Park. Upon arrival, check in to the charming Rosette Farmstead, nestled close to the park’s wilderness. Dinner and overnight stay at Rosette Farmstead.

Begin your day with an exciting morning safari in Rajaji National Park, exploring its diverse landscape of sal forests, grasslands, and riverbeds—home to elephants, leopards, and rich birdlife. After a relaxing afternoon, head out again for an evening safari, offering a chance to witness the park’s wildlife as it becomes active at dusk. An unforgettable wilderness experience awaits. Dinner and overnight stay at Rosette Farmstead.

Begin your day with a morning safari in Rajaji National Park, exploring its scenic terrain of dense forests, grasslands, and riverine ecosystems. The park offers excellent chances to spot elephants, leopards, spotted deer, and vibrant birdlife. After a break, venture out again on an evening safari, when wildlife activity peaks, offering a different perspective of the jungle as it transitions into dusk. Dinner and overnight stay at Rosette Farmstead.

After breakfast depart to Corbett which will be a 3 Hrsdrive, Arrive at Jim's Jungle Retreat, a serene wildernesslodge nestled in the southern buffer zone of CorbettTiger Reserve. After check-in and settling into youraccommodations, enjoy a short guided nature walk ledby the resident naturalist, offering an introduction to therich biodiversity of the region. Dinner & Overnight stay at Jim’s Jungle Retreat

Early morning, set out on a thrilling safari to the Jhirna or Dhela Zone—once reclaimed villages, now thriving wildlife habitats. These zones offer excellent opportunities to spot tigers, elephants, sloth bears, and great hornbills amidst rich natural surroundings. Return to the lodge for a hearty breakfast and lunch. In the afternoon, head back into the Jhirna/Dhela Zone, a striking mosaic of dry deciduous forest and riverbeds. This area is known for its frequent tiger and elephant sightings, making for an exciting wildlife experience. Dinner & Overnight stay at Jim’s Jungle Retreat

Venture into Bijrani, Corbett’s most scenic zone with open meadows and sal forest, often dotted with tiger pugmarks and birdlife. Return to the lodge for lunch. In the afternoon, enjoy another safari into either Jhirna or Dhela, depending on latest wildlife movement. Dinner & Overnight stay at Jim’s Jungle Retreat.
After breakfast and check-out, begin your scenic drive through the lush Terai landscape, arriving at Tiger Lilly Lodge by evening. Dinner & Overnight stay at Tiger Lilly Dudhwa

Embark on morning and evening safaris in the lesser- visited Kishanpur Wildlife Sanctuary, a vast open grassland landscape renowned as one of the best locations in the Terai to spot tigers. The sanctuary also supports healthy populations of swamp deer, hog deer, and a variety of raptors, making for a rich and rewarding wildlife experience. Dinner and overnight stay at Tiger Lilly, Dudhwa.

Experience morning and afternoon safaris in the iconic Dudhwa National Park, a biodiverse haven of alluvial grasslands, wetlands, and towering sal forests. Keep an eye out for the majestic Indian one-horned rhinoceros, elephants, and an impressive array of birdlife that thrive in this unique ecosystem. Dinner and overnight stay at Tiger Lilly, Dudhwa
After breakfast, check out from Tiger Lilly and embark on a scenic 8.5-hour drive to Delhi. Upon arrival, check in to Novotel Delhi. Dinner and overnight stay at Novotel Delhi.
After breakfast check out from Novotel Delhi and transferred to Delhi airport for onward flight

tourName: North India wildlife holiday
generalInfo:
With a strong focus on wildlife, this exciting and comprehensive itinerary takes in four key wildlife viewing areas and is perfect for those looking for big cat encounters, with opportunities to see not only tigers and leopards, but also the rare Asiatic lion. Add to these, myriad birds and other wildlife, plus sunrise at the magical Taj Mahal and you have an unforgettable Indian experience.

Highlights Include:

- Rare Asiatic lions at Sassan Gir
- Tigers at Ranthambhore
- Leopards, wolves and other mammals
- Guided birdwatching
- Taj Mahal at dawn

Accommodation:

Gir Lion Safari Camp - 3 nights full board with game drives
Fern Hotel Ahmedabad - 1 night with with dinner and breakfast
Bera Safari Lodge - 3 nights full board with guided safaris
Tiger Den Resort Ranthambore - 3 nights full board with shared game drives
Crystal Sarovar Premiere Hotel Agra - 1 night with dinner and breakfast
Red Fox Aerocity Delhi - 1 night with dinner and breakfast

Please note: from prices shown are for low season (Apr-Jun), please ask for high season rates (Oct-Mar). Accommodation is subject to change. All domestic transfers and travel as per the itinerary are included in your package.

dayInfo.description: Mumbai to Sasan Gir: International flights are not included as part of your package but can be arranged and added with ease. This morning you will arrive independently to Mumbai airport and take a morning flight to Rajkot. Upon arrival in Rajkot you will be transferred by private car to Sasan Gir, an approximately 4-hour drive. After checking in at the Gir Lion safari Camp the rest of the evening will be at your leisure. 3 nights accommodation at Gir Lion Safari Camp on a full board basis including breakfast, lunches, dinners and game drives.

Sasan Gir: Morning and afternoon jeep safaris on days 2 and 3. Expect to see rare Asiatic lions, plus other wildlife and birds. Possible sightings of leopards. On day 4, take morning jeep safari in Gir Park and then an afternoon 6 hour drive in a private car through the countryside to Ahmedabad. Overnight at the Fern hotel with dinner and breakfast.
Bera: After breakfast, depart for six hour drive in private car to Bera. Afternoon guided safari in the Sanctuary looking to spot leopards. Overnight at Bera Safari Lodge on full board basis.

Bera: The area around Bera is in the heart of leopard country and these days will include morning and afternoon jeep safaris looking out for these elusive animals as well as wolves and spectacular birdlife. Full board accommodation at Bera Safari Lodge.

Ranthambhore: Transfer to Udaipur Airport by private car in time to board the 11.30 flight to Jaipur, arriving at 13.25. Upon arrival in Jaipur your private transfer will take you to Ranthambore, a drive of approximately 3.5 hours. After checking in at the Tiger Den Resort the remainder of day will be at your leisure. 3 nights’ accommodation at the Tiger Den Resort on a full board basis including breakfast, lunches, dinners and shared game drives.

Ranthambhore: Morning and afternoon jeep safaris within the national park looking for tigers plus other mammals and birds. Rathambhore is rich in history with ancient ruins and temples, set in wooded and marshy and lake-land countryside. Once the hunter grounds of the maharajahs of Jaipur and later the British, Ranthambhore National Park (Sawai Madhopur) was declared a wildlife sanctuary in 1955. The wildlife, including the tiger population is thankfully flourishing so the Indian government have decided to increase the national park to encompass a range of hills close to Ranthambhore to ensure the Tiger populations have the space to grow. Expect to see tiger, sloth bear, mongoose, samber, cheetal, langur monkeys and if you are lucky also leopard, hyena, jackal and march crocodile. Excellent birding opportunities including paradise flycatcher, serpent eagle, jacana, painted stork, Bonellis eagle, horned owl, grey partridge, white necked stork, king vulture, ring dove, golden backed woodpecker and many more. Do not miss the opportunity to visit the fort which is a wonderful backdrop to the majestic landscape and its many lakes. Full board accommodation at Tiger Den Resort

Ranthambhore & On to Agra: A last jeep safari in the morning in Ranthambhore before transferring to Sawai Madhopur railway station for fast train to Bharatpur departing at 12.30. Arriving at Bharatpur at 15.00, transfer by car to Agra ( one hour) and check in to hotel Crystal Sarovar Premiere Hotel for dinner and overnight.

Agra: Up early for a guided visit to the Taj Mahal at dawn to experience the magic of sunrise over this monument to love. In the afternoon, drive by private car to Delhi. Overnight in hotel Red Fox Aerocity with dinner.
Delhi: Breakfast at hotel and then transfer to airport for return or onward travel

tourName: Northern India tour, temples and tigers
placesVisited: Tours of Old and New Delhi, Agra, including a sunrise tour of the Taj Mahal, Jaipur via the Abhaneri stepwell, Amber Fort & Jaipur City, safari drives in Ranthambore National Park
generalInfo:
Combining time exploring India’s Golden Triangle with two nights in Ranthambore National Park on the trail looking for tigers, this northern India holiday has the perfect mix of history and natural history. Starting in Delhi, you’ll explore both Old Delhi and New Delhi via rickshaw rides, street food and tours of the mix of modern and Mughal architecture. Next: on to Agra, then Jaipur, before your time in Ranthambore.

Historic sights come thick and fast on this trip. In Agra you’ll see the Taj Mahal at sunrise and in Jaipur, you can’t miss the Amber Fort, City Palace and Jantar Mantar Observatory.

Ranthambore isn’t just about tigers: this famous national park has over 300 species of bird, plus 30 mammals including sloth bears, leopards, monkeys, wild boar, jackal, deer and antelope – you’ll never know what will cross the path when you’re out in the park travelling in a canter (open backed lorry). This trip includes two game drives, but you have the opportunity to book an additional one, if you want more time searching for tigers.

Your trip supports local communities by giving you lovely personal experiences with families and people who live in the area. In Agra, you’ll visit a cafe that supports the victims of acid attacks. A local villager will give you a Mughal Heritage Walk through the villages that lie on the other side of the river from the Taj Mahal – providing a unique perspective not just of the mausoleum but of local life in Agra. In Jaipur you’ll take part in a block printing workshop and, in Agra, an optional thali cooking lesson with a Hindu family.

The holiday ends with a relaxing train ride back to Delhi – so you can sit back, look at the landscape, and think back on your fantastic trip to some of the best sights in northern India.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Delhi, transfer to hotel included Once you arrive in Delhi, you'll be met by one of our local staff, who will transfer your hotel. Once you're settled in, we'll run through the tour itinerary for the next few days, brief you on the local area and arrange a time to collect you tomorrow. OVERNIGHT

Exploring Delhi, Rickshaw Ride & Street Food Tasting Your day starts with a morning tour of India's capital, New Delhi. Built on the banks of the Yamuna river, New Delhi is a beautiful blend of a historical past and a vibrant present. We start at India Gate in the centre of New Delhi, a 42-metre high "Arc-de-Triomphe" like archway, a war memorial built to commemorate the 82,000 soldiers who partook in the undivided Indian Army. We'll drive past various government buildings such as the President's Palace and the Parliament of India, before passing Humayun's Tomb - a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and the Bangla Sahab Gurudwara Sikh Temple. We'll stop at Connaught Place Station and join the locals on the metro to Old Delhi where we'll walk through one of the oldest and busiest markets in Old Delhi, Chandni Chowk, before exploring the narrow streets of Chawri Bazar which specialises in selling brass, copper and paper products. Throughout the afternoon our guide will also introduce you to the wide range of street food snacks and delicacies so you can get your first authentic taste of the delicious and varied Indian cuisine. Our walking tour will also take in a rickshaw ride and the Jama Masjid mosque, one of the largest in India. OVERNIGHT

Head to Agra. Sheroes Hangout, Mughal Heritage Walk. First glimpse of the Taj Mahal We head to Agra this morning, home of the famous Taj Mahal. After arriving in Agra we'll make a stop for lunch at the Sheroes Hangout Cafe The cafe was set up by the Chhanv Foundation and is run by victirms of acid attacks. The cafe works to raise awareness of acid attacks in India and to empower those who have sadly been the victims of these heinous crimes. Prior to gaining employment in the cafe, many of the 'Sheroes' led solitary lives, rarely going outside due to shame associated with their scars. At Encounters Travel we're proud to support such an organisation, which has the sole aim of helping these women find acceptance, a supportive community and a means of income. Lunch will be included whilst at the cafe. Once you've checked in into your hotel, we'll spend the afternoon on a Mughal Heritage Walk through the ancient village of Kachhpura and surrounding farmland on the banks of the Yamuna River across from the Taj Mahal and Red Fort. This walk has been designed by a local NGO and helps support the local community through employment and new infrastructure. During the walk one of the villagers will give a guide to their village life, the layout of their homes, with living, cooking & religious areas, the farming done, and the local cottage industry for leather shoe making which helps Agra export shoes all over the world. You'll also see some lesser known but important Mughal era monuments. Finally today we'll stroll around the park at Mehtab Bagh - originally built by Emperor Babur as the last in a series of 11 parks on the Yamuna River's east bank, before taking in the magnificent sight of the Taj Mahal at sunset. A special evening option is available today, where you can join a Hindu family for a Vegetarian Thali cooking lesson and meal. OVERNIGHT

Taj Mahal sunrise. Drive to Suroth Mahal, Village Walking tour We start today early for our tour of the Taj Mahal. Truly one of the wonders of the world this elaborate monument to love was built by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan and took over twenty-two years to complete. Sunrise is a great time to visit as the light changes gradually with the colours of the Taj changing too. After breakfast we leave the region's popular tourist areas and head into the heart of rural Rajasthan to the small town of Suroth. The property was a former palace, now welcoming guests as a hotel, but retaining its heritage charm, with rooms painted with murals. The afternoon sees us exploring the village, interacting with the local villagers, getting invaluable insight into seeing their way of life. Our walking tour will pass by local shops, down narrow streets, we'll visit a small temple and perhaps even visit a local barber shop where you can have a shave or head massage. In the evening we'll have a cooking demonstration before enjoying dinner at the hotels restaurant. OVERNIGHT

To Jaipur via the Abhaneri step well. Optional Bollywood Movie or Cooking Demo Today we head to Jaipur, the capital and the largest city of the Indian state of Rajasthan in Western India. Enroute, we'll visit the Abhaneri step well, the largest and deepest step well in the world, which boasts 3500 steps and is 13 stories deep. You may recognise this as the place that Sonny tried to express his feelings for Sunaina in the recent movie The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel. The remaider of the day in Jaipur will be free to explore at leisure or join one of our optional EXTRAS

Amber Fort & Jaipur City. Block printing workshop You have an option of going on an early morning hot air balloon ride over Jaipur, flying over its palaces, forts and lakes - a truly mesmerising experience. If you chose to sleep a little later, your morning starts with a visit to the Amber Fort, the jewel in Jaipur's crown - an ancient fortress built on a hilltop in the 16th century dedicated to the ruling Kachhawa clan of Amber. Be mesmerised by this majestic architectural wonder, with its pink sandstone and marble palace shining in the sun. It's massive fortress walls sprawls across the hills, with many seeing a resemblance of the Great Wall of China. Later, we return to the city for a tour of Jaipur, as we visit the strange Jantar Mantar monument, a collection of nineteen architectural astronomical instruments, built by the Rajput king Sawai Jai Singh II between 1724 and 1730. Jaipur was the first planned city of medieval India and we'll also explore its City Palace. Built by Raja Man Singh during 1729-1732 AD, the City Palace was once the seat of kings as it was from here that they ruled the region. This tangle of courtyards, manicured gardens and exceptionally crafted mahals is one of the most revered attractions in India. We spend the remainder of the day walking in the walled city to discover some of Jaipur's famous crafts markets and craftsmen in action such as jewellers, silversmiths, textile workshops and bangle makers. Our tour will include a blockprinting workshop, where we learn the ways in which fabric is decorated using this ancient method and we'll also have a gemstone demonstation. OVERNIGHT

Ranthambore - Home of the Bengal Tiger. Afternoon Game Drive We leave Jaipur today and head to Ranthambore National Park, which is named after Ranthambore fortress, located within its boundaries. If you're looking to see tigers in the wild, this is the place to be. In 1973, the park was established as a sanctuary for the tigers and to help decrease the fatal interactions that were increasing between humans and tigers. We'll have our first chance to see Tigers this afternoon as we join a shared canter for game drive through the park. OVERNIGHT

Morning Game Drive in search of tigers We'll head back out on an early morning game drive, giving you the best opportunity to see India's tigers in their natural habitat, but keep your eyes peeled for other wildlife such as leopards, sloth bears, black bucks, flying foxes, Indian porcupines, striped hyenas, jackals, jungle cats, wild boar, civets, desert cats, macaques, mole rats, and many more species. We'll be transported through the jungle in an open-backed truck (shared canter), which allows us to travel deep into the park, as we search for India's unique wildlife. We'll also visit the ruined fort located within the boundaries of the park, which is beautifully elevated on a natural hummock, which towers at just over 200 metres high. The ancient ruined fort is also a UNESCO World Heritage Site. In the afternoon you'll have some free time to relax or you could consider booking additional private jeep or shared game drives within the park. OVERNIGHT

Train ride to Delhi. Free afternoon (optional visit to the Akshardam Temple) We'll say goodbye to Ranthambore and board a train back to Delhi. Our preferred service is the Kota Jan Shtabad leaving at 0725. The train ride will last for about five hours, but it's one of the best ways to experience the beauty of India, as you make your way past the rural countryside and farmlands as well as the bustling city life as you approach the capital. Once we arrive in Delhi, you'll be transferred to your hotel and have some free time in the afternoon for last minute shopping or exploration. You could also join our optional tour to the Hindu Akshardam Temple. OVERNIGHT

All good things come to an end! Airport transfer included You have some free time to buy any gifts for your loved ones back home before we transfer you to the airport to catch your flight back home. Additional half day tours are available this morning if you have a later flight, and extension options are also available. OVERNIGHT

tourName: Small cats of India wildlife tour
generalInfo:
Embark on an extraordinary 16-day wildlife expedition across India, exploring diverse ecosystems and capturing stunning images of some of the most elusive wild cats. From the bustling streets of Delhi to the tranquil wetlands of Kolkata, and the rugged landscapes of Jawai, this journey promises breathtaking encounters with nature’s finest feline hunters.

Highlights of Your Itinerary
Fishing Cat Encounter in Kolkata – Experience exclusive overnight hide sessions to observe and photograph the elusive fishing cat in its natural wetland habitat. Jungle Cat Safaris in Velavadar – Discover the grasslands of Velavadar National Park, home to jungle cats, blackbuck, and other fascinating wildlife.
Rusty-Spotted Cat Adventures in Jawai – Explore the rocky terrain of Jawai, a prime location for sightings of one of the smallest wild cats in the world.
Expert-Led Wildlife Exploration – Guided safaris and research-backed insights enhance your chances of wildlife sightings and successful photography.

Luxurious Stays & Authentic Cuisine – Experience India’s hospitality with comfortable accommodations and delicious local meals.
This journey is perfect for nature enthusiasts and wildlife photographers seeking rare and unique photographic opportunities. With carefully planned hide setups and expert-led safaris, you'll leave with unforgettable memories and remarkable images of India's wild cats.

dayInfo.description: Arrival at Delhi Arrive Delhi. Overnight stay at Radisson Blu or similar, (Bed & Breakfast)

Delhi to Kolkata Check out of the hotel and fly from Delhi to Kolkata. Drive to Dhulagori (about 3 hours) and check in at the Stay Vista Hotel. Enjoy lunch and take some time to rest. In the evening, the guests will visit Howrah to experience and observe the fishing cats in a hide. Daily all night exclusive sessions of hide to search for Fishing cat(Full Board) Fishing cat The fishing cat (Prionailurus viverrinus) is a small wild cat found in South and Southeast Asia, primarily in wetland habitats such as swamps, marshes, and rivers. Here are some key points that you can include in your itinerary related to the fishing cat: Habitat Prefers marshy areas, wetlands, and riverine floodplains. Commonly found in countries like India, Bangladesh, Nepal, Sri Lanka, Myanmar, Thailand, and Vietnam. Behavior Diet: Primarily feeds on fish, which is why it is called the fishing cat. It can also consume amphibians, crustaceans, and small mammals. Hunting Method: Known for its unique hunting technique where it uses its partially webbed feet to help catch fish. It can even submerge itself to catch prey. Nocturnal: Mainly active at night (nocturnal) but may also be seen during the day. Conservation Status Classified as Vulnerable by the IUCN Red List due to habitat loss, hunting, and human-wildlife conflict. Efforts are being made to protect its natural habitats and ensure its survival. Hide setup "Embark on a thrilling photography adventure in Kolkata, tailored to capture the elusive fishing cat Spend a leisurely day, followed by an evening excursion to a specially designed hide, strategically located near a pond where the cat is known to hunt. With a high probability of spotting, be prepared for a waiting game that can vary in duration, as the cat's feeding schedule dictates its appearance. However, when it does arrive, the permanently installed lighting system ensures optimal conditions for capturing stunning images. Take advantage of the cat's Fearlessness, allowing for extended photography opportunities, and make the most of this unique setup designed specifically for photography enthusiasts."

Morning breakfast, day at leisure lunch at hotel and after early dinner embark on search for the elusive fishing cat. Explore the designated areas where this fascinating creature to known to reside. Daily all night exclusive sessions of hide to search for Fishing cat(Full Board) Return to hotel at night overnight at Stay Vista

Kolkata to Blackbuck Lodge Start your day with breakfast, then head to Kolkata Airport to catch your connecting flight to Ahmedabad. After arrival in Ahmedabad drive to Black Buck Lodge, Velavadar Nation park for seeing the illusive Jungle Cat. Dinner & Overnight stay at BlackBuck Safari Lodge.(Full Board)

Early morning & evening safaris in the grassland of Velavadar National park, looking for Jungle Cat On the grasslands of the National Park. This park gives you the opportunity to photograph the cat in the day as well.(Full Board) Velavadar National Park, located in Gujarat, India, is a hidden gem renowned for its unique grassland ecosystem and diverse wildlife. Spanning over 34 square Kilometers this park is particularly famous for its population of jungle cats, which are often seen hunting in the early mornings and late evenings. You can explore the park through designated trails, providing excellent opportunities for wildlife photography. Apart from jungle cats, the park is home to various species like blackbuck, foxes, and numerous birds, making it a paradise for nature enthusiasts. The best time to visit is during the winter months, February, when wildlife activity is at its peak. With its stunning landscapes and vibrant fauna, Velavadar National Park promises an unforgettable adventure for wildlife lovers to see and Photograph the Jungle Cat.

Velavadar to Jawai After Breakfast check out from Blackbuck Safari Lodge to Jawai Overnight stay at Verawal Leopard Camp. Jawai, located in the Pali district of Rajasthan, India, is an emerging wildlife destination known for its impressive biodiversity and picturesque landscapes. This area is particularly famous for its high density of the elusive rusty-spotted cat, one of the smallest wild cat species in the world. Known for its striking coat and playful nature, the rusty-spotted cat can be spotted most often during the early morning and late evening hours. Jawai’s unique rocky terrains and dense scrub forests create perfect habitats for these cats, making it one of the best places for enthusiasts to Photograph them in their natural environment. Safaris are available, where experienced tour Leader & Naturalist increases your chances of sightings, not only of rusty-spotted cats. The research of this cat will start a month in advance before guests arrives to understand the pattern of the denning sights for better photographic opportunities in day as well as night. The ideal time to visit is February, which offers cooler weather & best time to see the Rusty Spotted Cats.

Early morning & evening safaris in Jawai, looking for Rusty spotted Cats On the rocky terrain of the landscape making it a perfect habitat for the denning sight. This park gives you the opportunity to photograph the Rusty Spotted Cat in the day as well. (Full Board)
Jawai to Udaipur to Delhi After morning game drive its time to depart to Udaipur for catching a flight to Delhi Dinner & Overnight in Delhi.
Departure Transfer to Delhi International Airport for a Flight Back to Home

tourName: Southern India tailor made tour, Jungle trails
placesVisited: Bandipur National Park, Elephants of Nagarahole, Mudumalai, the Wildlife Corridor Kerala's tea city, Munnar, Niligiri Tahrs of Eravikulam, Periyar National Park, Boat ride in Periyar, Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary, Houseboat cruise to Alappuzha
generalInfo:
